question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden remain President through the end of July 2024 and not die before Saturday, July 26th, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (Eastern Time). This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not cause a NO resolution as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution. (b) There is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves YES. If either or both conditions are not satisfied, the question resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden continue to hold the office of President until the conclusion of July 2024 and survive until Saturday, July 26th, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) Joe Biden stays as the US President until the end of July 2024 (Eastern Time), meaning he does not resign, pass away, or otherwise stop being President prior to that date. A temporary power transfer under the 25th amendment, which makes his Vice President the Acting President, will not result in a NO resolution, as Acting President is distinct from President according to the Constitution. (b) There is no formal declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, 2024. If both criteria are met, the resolution will be YES. If either or both criteria are not met, the resolution will be NO.

(b) There is no formal declaration of Joe Biden's death prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th, 2024. If both criteria are met, the question will resolve to YES. If either or both criteria are not met, the question will resolve to NO.

A temporary delegation of power under the 25th amendment, where his Vice President acts as President, will not result in a NO answer since Acting President is not the same as President according to the Constitution. question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, July 26th, 2024, or (b) Joe Biden does not remain President through the end of July 2024?

(b) Joe Biden ceases to be the US President before the end of July 2024 (ET) due to resignation, death, or any other reason. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect the YES resolution for part (b). Otherwise, the question resolves NO.

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

para_P.title: Will the United States secure a greater number of Gold medals compared to Silver medals at the 2024 Olympics in Paris?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be affirmed with a Yes if the Olympic Team of the United States achieves a higher count of Gold medals than Silver medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games.

para_P.title: Will the USA secure a greater number of Gold medals compared to Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with Yes if the United States Olympic Team achieves a higher total of Gold medals than Silver medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics.

para_P.title: Will the USA obtain more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will receive a Yes response if the United States Olympic Team earns a greater count of Gold medals in comparison to Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Will the USA both top the Olympic Medal Table and win as many or more Silver than Gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if both of the following occur:
(a) The United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

(b) The United States Olympic Team wins as many or more Silver medals than Gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

The question will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027.

para_P.title: Will the USA be the leading nation in the Olympic Medal Table and secure at least as many Silver medals as Gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the following conditions are satisfied:
(a) The United States Olympic Team emerges as the (sole) top-ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal standings are determined by tallying all the medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them by:
1. Total number of Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie at 1) Total number of Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie at 2) Total number of Bronze Medals

(b) The United States Olympic Team achieves at least as many Silver medals as Gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

The question will be deemed unclear if the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027.

para_P.title: Will the USA finish at the top of the Olympic Medal Rankings and secure at least as many Silver medals as Gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the following conditions are met:
(a) The United States Olympic Team is the (sole) leading team in the standings at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal rankings are determined by aggregating all medals earned by each competing nation and ordering them based on:
1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie in 1) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie in 2) Total Bronze Medals

(b) The United States Olympic Team achieves at least as many Silver medals as Gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

The question will be deemed unclear if the Paris Olympics do not occur prior to 2027.

para_P.title: Will the United States end up leading the Olympic Medal Standings and obtain no fewer Silver medals than Gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered positively if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:
(a) The United States Olympic Team stands as the (only) top team in the rankings at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal standings are established by totaling all medals won by each participating country and ranking them based on:
1. Overall Gold Medals
2. (If there is a tie in 1) Overall Silver Medals
3. (If there is a tie in 2) Overall Bronze Medals

(b) The United States Olympic Team secures at least an equal number of Silver medals to Gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

The inquiry will be considered ambiguous if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027.

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) The USA wins more Gold than Silver medals (b) The USA tops the Olympic Medal Table?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if either of the following conditions are met:
(a) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.
(b) The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics, based on the medal table which orders countries by the number of Gold medals, then Silver medals, then Bronze medals. This question resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It resolves NO if neither condition is met.

para_P.title: Is it possible that at the Paris 2024 Olympics, (a) the USA secures a greater number of Gold medals than Silver or (b) the USA leads the Olympic Medal Rankings?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will yield a YES answer if at least one of the two following scenarios occurs:
(a) The United States Olympic Team achieves a higher count of Gold medals compared to Silver medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics.
(b) The United States Olympic Team stands as the sole highest-ranked team in the medal standings at the 2024 Paris Olympics, which are determined by the number of Gold medals first, followed by Silver and then Bronze medals. The question will be considered ambiguous if the Paris Olympics do not happen prior to 2027. A NO answer will be given if neither of the scenarios is fulfilled.

para_P.title: Is it possible that at the Paris 2024 Olympics, (a) the USA secures a greater number of Gold medals than Silver medals or (b) the USA leads the Olympic Medal Table?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if at least one of the following scenarios occurs:
(a) The United States Olympic Team achieves a higher count of Gold medals compared to Silver medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics.
(b) The United States Olympic Team ranks as the sole highest team in the medal standings at the 2024 Paris Olympics, according to the medal table that prioritizes countries by their Gold medal count, followed by Silver and then Bronze medals. This question will be deemed ambiguous if the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027. It will be answered with a NO if neither scenario takes place.

para_P.title: Could the USA end up with more Gold medals than Silver medals or top the Medal Table at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a YES response if at least one of the following conditions is met:
(a) The United States Olympic Team secures more Gold medals than Silver medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics.
(b) The United States Olympic Team is the highest-ranked team in the medal standings at the 2024 Paris Olympics, as per the medal table that ranks countries by their Gold medal totals, followed by Silver and then Bronze medals. If the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027, this question will be considered unclear. A NO answer will be given if neither condition is satisfied.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or barring must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude as "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may occur after the specified date. It solely addresses whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or barring must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The question will be answered with "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may take place after the specified date. It specifically relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the mentioned grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the question will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Could Donald Trump face disqualification or exclusion from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role as per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will receive a "Yes" response if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been formally disqualified or excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role (President, Senate, House of Representatives) in accordance with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or exclusion must be confirmed through official announcements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or reputable news outlets. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial comments will not suffice for resolution.

The answer will be "No" if these requirements are not met by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account legal challenges, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur after the specified date. It specifically pertains to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or excluded from a ballot but later reinstated, leading to him not being disqualified or excluded from any ballot as of July 15, the question will be resolved negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Donald Trump will not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. There must be no official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports confirming such a removal or block. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

The question will resolve as **No** if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot for any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that might take place after the specified date. It solely concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reputable media reports. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may take place after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being removed or blocked from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Could Donald Trump be barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a "Yes" answer if, by July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role (President, Senate, House of Representatives) as a result of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The barring must be confirmed through official statements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or credible media sources. Speculative information, opinion pieces, or unofficial comments will not suffice for a definitive answer.

The question will be answered with "No" if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account any legal challenges, appeals, or subsequent changes that may occur after the specified date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the mentioned grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and later reinstated, leading to him not being barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(a) This part of the question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

The question strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

A letter that has been drafted, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, represents the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are significantly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and I suppose through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He chose not to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 members from the House or Senators who are affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Latvia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Latvia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Latvia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Latvia fails to qualify, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

para_P.title: Is Latvia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Latvia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Latvia fails to qualify, the response will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: The answer to this question will be **Yes** if Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is later verified by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. On the other hand, if Latvia does not qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Belgium qualify and Latvia fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (similar to the situation in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to certain groups (such as minors), the answer will still be **YES**, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

In this context, "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web platform (not the API) used for engaging with GPT models. The answer will still be **YES** even if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries to systems utilizing Large Language Models).

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

para_P.title: Will Russia gain dominance over Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, upon review by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) displays the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E categorized under any of the subsequent classifications:



- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional classifications established by ISW that signify Russian control of the area



The inquiry will be deemed **No** if the site is not classified in any of the categories denoting Russian control, which encompasses but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Advances in the Last 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any other classifications created by ISW that signify Ukrainian control of the area or an absence of Russian control over the area.

para_P.title: Will Russia possess Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if, on June 1, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as falling under any of these classifications:



- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Control

- Asserted Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other classifications established by ISW that signify Russian control of the area



The inquiry will conclude as **No** if the location is not categorized under any indicators of Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Asserted Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other classifications established by ISW that signify Ukrainian control of the area or a lack of Russian control of the area.

para_P.title: Will Russia have control over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if, on June 1, 2024, upon evaluation by Metaculus, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as belonging to any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advances in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Previous 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Authority

- Declared Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional classifications defined by ISW that indicate Russian control over the area



The question will be answered with **No** if the site is not classified under any signs of Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Recorded Ukrainian Territorial Advances in the Previous 24 Hours

- Declared Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any additional classifications defined by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control over the area or a lack of Russian control over the area.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Russia does not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

(b) Will Russia not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

This resolves as Yes if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any categories indicating Ukrainian control or a lack of Russian control. It resolves as No if the location is in any categories indicating Russian control, including assessed Russian advance, gains, or control, or claimed Russian territory in Ukraine.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden makes an announcement prior to July 15, 2024, stating he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Russia does not possess control over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not be accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement that he will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unequivocal and definitive, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this will be considered No.

(b) Will Russia lack control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

This will be considered Yes if, when checked by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any categories that show Ukrainian control or a lack of Russian control. It will be considered No if the location falls under any categories indicating Russian control, including assessed Russian advances, gains, or control, or claimed Russian territory in Ukraine.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Joe Biden makes a public statement before July 15, 2024, declaring that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Russia will not be in control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official public statement that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear-cut and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election. If such an announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this will be considered No.

(b) Will Russia not have authority over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

This will be considered Yes if, when checked by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any categories that reflect Ukrainian control or a lack of Russian authority. It will be considered No if the area is categorized under Russian control, including evaluated Russian advances, gains, or control, or claimed Russian territory in Ukraine.

para_P.title: Are both of these events going to occur: (a) Joe Biden issues a public announcement prior to July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Russia will not possess control over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Is Joe Biden going to make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, in which he states that he will turn down the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This will be deemed Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign provides a clear and official public announcement that he will not seek or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States during the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unequivocal and definitive, leaving no room for interpretation that Biden might agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election. If such a statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this will be considered No.

(b) Is it true that Russia will not have control over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

This will be considered Yes if, upon verification by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any classifications indicating Ukrainian control or a lack of Russian dominance. It will be deemed No if the region is classified under Russian control, including assessed Russian advances, gains, or control, or recognized Russian territory in Ukraine.

question.title: Will either Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, or will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: (a) Russia is assessed to have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, according to the ISW map criteria, or (b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle.

Details for (a): This part will resolve as Yes if, according to the ISW map accessed on June 1, 2024, the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E are under categories indicating Russian control, such as "Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine" or similar categories. It will resolve as No if the location is not under categories indicating Russian control.

Details for (b): This part will resolve as Yes if Joe Biden makes an unambiguous and conclusive statement before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination. If no such statement is made by then, it will resolve as No.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from safe districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local news sources that they have given up on Biden's prospects for a November victory.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more intense. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these drafts would urge Biden to conclude his campaign, as per five individuals familiar with the situation.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborates to request Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter similar to what has been reported, or it might take the form of a group engaging in a personal discussion with Biden, collectively asking him to withdraw.

For a YES resolution, it is essential that all five individuals partake in the same group communication. If five individuals independently express to reporters their belief that Biden should step down, this will not be adequate for a YES outcome.

Any reports regarding an unspecified number of unnamed Democrats requesting Biden to resign will not meet the requirements of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market closes. In cases where names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

question.title: Will "Deadpool x Wolverine" have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie AND will Taylor Swift not cameo in the movie?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) "Deadpool x Wolverine" grosses more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend according to reports, AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release. (2) Taylor Swift does not appear in the movie "Deadpool x Wolverine" in any role, including voice roles. It will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB and there are no independent sources confirming her appearance.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election and Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Will both of the following occur: (a) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election, and (b) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria:

1. The first component will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

2. The second component will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this component will resolve as No.

This combined question will resolve as Yes if both components resolve as Yes.

In case of conflicting popular sources, an official statement from Ohio State will be referenced. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, the question will be void.

The second part will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not issue a clear, public, official statement declaring that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this part will be considered No.

This combined inquiry will be deemed Yes if both parts are resolved as Yes.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Vivek Ramaswamy going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** outcome. It is important to note that this question is not limited to the candidates listed currently; additional candidates may be included later.

For the purposes of this question, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; the determination is based solely on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election (b) Vivek Ramaswamy is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this question will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Rishi Sunak does not get elected in the 2024 UK General Election (b) Vivek Ramaswamy does not become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if, for any reason, Rishi Sunak does not secure a seat as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency during the July 4, 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**. The resolution should reference [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news sources or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is a candidate (if he is indeed a candidate in any constituency).

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other individual is nominated, this question will also resolve as **Yes**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may be introduced later. The determination for this question is not based on who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This question will be answered as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is chosen, this question will also be answered as **Yes**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional candidates may emerge in the future. (a) This question will receive a response of **Yes** if Rishi Sunak does not achieve election as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024, for any reason. If he is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency during this election, the answer will be **No**. If another candidate is selected, this question will also be answered as **Yes**. This assessment is not limited to the candidates currently known; new candidates may appear in the future. The answer to this question is strictly based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) and not on who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will either Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still be in the presidency at the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President at the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary handover of authority as outlined in the 25th amendment (such as designating his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (Acting President is distinct from President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still hold the office of President by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if Biden is still the President of the United States at the end of July 2024 (ET); it will resolve to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (An Acting President is not the same as the President as defined by the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden remain in the position of President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be determined as YES if Biden continues to be the President of the United States by the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); it will be NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before that date.

A temporary delegation of power under the 25th amendment (such as designating his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES outcome. (An Acting President does not equate to the President as outlined by the Constitution)

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed from a primary ballot for federal office under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Biden cease to be President before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the condition is not met.

2. Joe Biden ceases to be US President before the end of July 2024 (ET) by resigning, dying, or otherwise leaving office. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not meet this condition, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

The question resolves as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be disqualified from a primary election ballot for federal office due to the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Joe Biden no longer hold the presidency before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documentation, or reliable media sources. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The inquiry does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that might happen after the specified date. It specifically concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, so that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the condition is not fulfilled.

2. Joe Biden must no longer be the President of the United States before the conclusion of July 2024 (ET) by means of resignation, death, or other departure from office. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th Amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not satisfy this requirement, as Acting President is distinct from President according to the Constitution.

The inquiry will resolve as "No" if either or both of these criteria are not fulfilled.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Donald Trump will be disqualified from appearing on a primary ballot for federal office due to the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Joe Biden no longer hold the position of President before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

1. By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or prevention must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The inquiry does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the condition is not satisfied.

2. Joe Biden must no longer be the President of the United States before the end of July 2024 (ET) due to resignation, death, or other means of leaving office. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment (i.e., designating his Vice President as the Acting President) does not fulfill this requirement, as the Acting President is distinct from the President according to the Constitution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if either or both of these criteria are not fulfilled.

para_P.title: Could Donald Trump face disqualification from being on a primary ballot for federal office due to the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and might Joe Biden cease to be the President before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a "Yes" response if both of the following conditions are met:

1. By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The question does not take into account legal challenges, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the specified date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and is later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the condition is not met.

2. Joe Biden must no longer hold the office of President of the United States before the end of July 2024 (ET) due to resignation, death, or other means of departing from office. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th Amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not satisfy this requirement, as the Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution.

The question will be answered with "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will either Biden remain President through July 2024 or Trump be removed from a primary ballot under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024, meaning he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then (temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not count as ceasing to be President); (b) Donald Trump is officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: Will Biden continue to hold the presidency until July 2024, or will Trump be disqualified from a primary ballot due to the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body: Is it possible that one of the following will happen: (a) Biden stays in office as the President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024, which means he does not resign, pass away, or otherwise stop being President prior to that time (a temporary power transfer under the 25th Amendment does not count as stopping being President); (b) Donald Trump is formally disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. This inquiry does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later changes after July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: Will Biden still be in office by the end of July 2024, or will Trump face disqualification from a primary ballot under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body: Is it possible that one of the following will happen: (a) Biden continues as the President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024, meaning he does not resign, pass away, or otherwise stop being President before that time (a temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment does not count as ceasing to be President); (b) Donald Trump is officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This disqualification or prevention must be validated by official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. The question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or reversals that may occur after July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: By the conclusion of July 2024, will Biden remain in his presidential role, or will Trump be barred from the primary ballot due to the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body: Could it be that one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) Biden remains the President of the United States until the end of July 2024, meaning he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before that date (a temporary power transfer under the 25th Amendment does not count as ceasing to be President); (b) Donald Trump is formally disqualified or barred from being listed on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) as per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This disqualification or barring must be confirmed by official statements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or credible news outlets. The inquiry does not take into account any legal challenges, appeals, or reversals that might take place after July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) At least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024, AND (2) The EU does not announce new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024?
question.body:
(1) At least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators must work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form of collective action. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. Ambiguous cases will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, 2024, this condition resolves NO.

(2) The European Union (EU) must not announce any new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This condition will resolve as YES if there are no credible reports of the EU announcing new tariffs or duties that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU before the specified date.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) At least 5 specific Democratic House Representatives or US Senators will urge Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th, 2024, AND (2) The EU does not declare new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) A minimum of 5 identified Democratic Party members from the US House of Representatives or US Senators must collaborate to persuade Joe Biden to contemplate ceasing his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could occur through signing a letter or any form of joint action. All five individuals must be included in the same group communication. Merely having five individuals express their opinions separately to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient. Reports involving any number of unnamed Democrats requesting Biden to step down will not meet the requirements unless at least 5 qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the deadline. Ambiguous situations will be resolved in favor of NO. If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, 2024, this aspect will resolve as NO.

(2) The European Union (EU) must refrain from announcing any new tariffs or taxes on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This condition will be considered YES if there are no credible reports of the EU declaring new tariffs or taxes that would impact the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU before the stated date.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (1) A minimum of 5 identified Democratic House Representatives or US Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20th, 2024, AND (2) The EU refrains from declaring new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) A minimum of 5 identified members of the Democratic Party from the US House or Senate must collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate halting his 2024 presidential campaign, or encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could occur through signing a letter or another form of collective initiative. All five individuals must engage in the same group communication. Merely having five individuals separately express to the media that they believe Biden should withdraw is inadequate. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and requesting him to resign will not fulfill the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the deadline. Cases that are unclear will default to a NO resolution. If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, 2024, this condition will resolve as NO.

(2) The European Union (EU) must not make any announcements regarding new tariffs or duties on Chinese electric vehicle imports before July 5, 2024. This condition will be considered YES if there are no credible reports of the EU imposing new tariffs or duties that would affect the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU before the specified deadline.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will occur: (1) At least 5 recognized Democratic House Representatives or US Senators call on Biden to step back from the race before July 20th, 2024, AND (2) The EU does not announce any new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body:

Simply having five individuals independently convey to the media that they think Biden should withdraw is insufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and asking him to resign will not meet the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the deadline. Cases that are ambiguous will default to a NO resolution. If these conditions are not met before July 20th, 2024, this condition will resolve as NO.

(2) The European Union (EU) must refrain from making any announcements regarding new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This condition will be considered YES if there are no credible reports of the EU imposing new tariffs or duties that would affect the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU before the specified deadline.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (1) The EU announce new tariffs on Chinese EV imports, or (2) A group of 5 named Dem lawmakers pressure Biden to drop out?
question.body:
(1) The EU announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This will resolve as **Yes** if credible sources report that the EU has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(2) A group of at least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter, speaking with Biden in person, or another form of collective action. All five individuals must be part of the same group message, and the names must be made public. In ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this will resolve NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following will happen prior to their specified deadlines: (1) The EU will declare new tariffs on electric vehicle imports from China, or (2) A coalition of 5 identified Democratic lawmakers will pressure Biden to withdraw from the race?
para_P.body:
(1) The EU makes an announcement regarding new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This will be marked as **Yes** if reliable sources indicate that the EU has declared that new tariffs or duties will be enforced on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(2) A coalition consisting of at least 5 identified Democratic Party members of the US House of Representatives or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate stepping down from his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before July 20, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could occur through signing a letter, engaging in direct conversation with Biden, or another method of collective action. All five individuals must be included in the same group communication, and their names must be publicly disclosed. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this will resolve NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following takes place prior to their deadlines: (1) The EU declares new tariffs on electric vehicle imports from China, or (2) A coalition of 5 specified Democratic lawmakers pressurize Biden to withdraw from the race?
para_P.body:
(1) The EU declares new tariffs or duties on the importation of electric vehicles from China before July 5, 2024. This will be marked as **Yes** if reliable sources indicate that the EU has announced new tariffs or duties that will be applicable to the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(2) A coalition of at least 5 identified Democratic Party members of the US House of Representatives or US Senators collaborates to urge Joe Biden to contemplate terminating his 2024 re-election campaign, or to strongly encourage him to do so, before July 20, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could occur through signing a letter, having a face-to-face discussion with Biden, or through another form of collective action. All five individuals must be included in the same group communication, and their names must be publicly disclosed. In cases of uncertainty where such names are reported but not verified beyond a reasonable doubt, this will resolve NO.

para_P.title: Could either of the following events occur before their respective deadlines: (1) The European Union imposes new tariffs on electric vehicle imports from China, or (2) A group of 5 specific Democratic lawmakers pressure Biden to withdraw from the presidential race?
para_P.body:
(1) The European Union imposes new tariffs or duties on the import of electric vehicles from China prior to July 5, 2024. This will be considered **Yes** if credible sources report that the EU has enacted new tariffs or duties affecting the import of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(2) A coalition of at least 5 identified members of the Democratic Party in the US House of Representatives or US Senate works together to persuade Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly advocate for him to do so, before July 20, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be done through signing a letter, having a direct conversation with Biden, or through another method of joint action. All five individuals must be part of the same group communication, and their identities must be made public. In situations where such names are mentioned but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).
