question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district, previously held by Bill Johnson. In case of disagreement among popular sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, this part of the question is annulled.

2. Liz Cheney is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this condition is satisfied. para_P.title: Is it possible for Lithuania to advance while Greece does not make it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both conditions are satisfied: (a) Lithuania takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Greece does not make it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The answer will be **No** if either Lithuania fails to qualify or Greece qualifies.

para_P.title: Is it true that Lithuania will make it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final while Greece will not?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both conditions are met: (a) Lithuania takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Greece does not advance to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Lithuania fails to qualify or Greece qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will Lithuania qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final while Greece fails to do so?
para_P.body: This question will receive a response of **Yes** if the following two conditions are satisfied: (a) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Greece does not progress to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Lithuania does not qualify or Greece qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Greece or Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Greece nor Lithuania qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Greece or Lithuania make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Greece competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Lithuania competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Greece nor Lithuania advances, the inquiry will be marked as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Greece or Lithuania make it to the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) Greece competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualifying for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. (b) Lithuania competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualifying for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. If neither Greece nor Lithuania qualifies, the response will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will either Greece or Lithuania reach the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This question will receive a **Yes** answer if at least one of the following occurs: (a) Greece participates in a Semi-final and is verified by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as advancing to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. (b) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is verified by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as advancing to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. If neither Greece nor Lithuania advances, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3, based on the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be settled based on the lead of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, as retrieved by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the margin by which Donald Trump leads Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 but less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question will be determined by the extent to which Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number means Biden is in front. For example, if on July 5, 2024, the reported number indicates Trump is leading Biden by 2.4 points, this would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President AND will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is less than or equal to 2 points or greater than 3 points, as reported on the chart for that date and accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

If both conditions are not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration prior to July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden be either 2 points or fewer, or exceed 3 points on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be explicit and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is either 2 points or fewer, or more than 3 points, as shown in the chart for that date and accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates a Biden lead.

If both criteria are not fulfilled, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Before July 15, 2024, will Joe Biden publicly declare that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President AND will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden be either 2 points or less or exceed 3 points on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the following two criteria are satisfied:

1. Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not pursue nor accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear-cut and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the upcoming presidential election is either 2 points or fewer, or greater than 3 points, as recorded on the chart for that day and referenced by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden.

If both criteria are not fulfilled, this question will be answered as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and will Donald Trump's lead over Biden be either 2 points or lower or more than 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered **Yes** if these two conditions are met:

1. Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign releases a clear and official public statement confirming that he will not seek or accept his party's nomination for another term in the 2024 presidential election. The statement must be unequivocal, leaving no doubt that Biden would not agree to take the Democratic Party's nomination.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the upcoming presidential election is either 2 points or fewer, or exceeds 3 points, as shown on the chart for that date and cited by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number shows a lead for Biden.

If both conditions are not met, this inquiry will be answered **No**.

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

2. Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If neither of these conditions is met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump have a lead over Joe Biden that is more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to the national polling average from 538, or will Joe Biden publicly declare before this date that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place:

1. Donald Trump’s advantage over Joe Biden is recorded as greater than 2 and not exceeding 3 in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead.

2. Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue nor accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election. The announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle.

If neither of these scenarios occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 in 538's national polling average, or will Joe Biden publicly declare before this date that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs:

1. Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead.

2. Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that he will not pursue and will not accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election. This announcement must be unequivocal and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If neither of these conditions is satisfied, this question will be answered as **No**.

para_P.title: By July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 but less than or equal to 3 in the national polling average from 538, or will Joe Biden make a public announcement before this date stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This question will be marked as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met:

1. Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden by more than 2 and at most 3 in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as recorded on the chart from July 15, 2024, when assessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. Here, a positive number signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates Biden is in front.

2. Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign releases a clear and official public statement declaring that he will not seek or accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election. This declaration must be unmistakable and conclusive: it should remove any doubt that Biden would consent to the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States for the 2024 election cycle.

If neither of these criteria is fulfilled, the answer to this question will be **No**.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a higher likelihood of winning than Joe Biden on that same date. In the event that Biden and Trump are assessed to have equal probabilities, this market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the values shown by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any changes in FiveThirtyEight's calculation methods will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. The resolution may be delayed until the July 20 data is accessible. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the closest prior figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution will reference the winning probabilities of each candidate as a figure out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

para_P.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater likelihood of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a higher chance of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the same forecast for July 19, 2024. In the event that both candidates are projected to have equal chances, the outcome will be a 50-50 result.

The source for this resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, particularly focusing on the values shown by the blue and red trend lines for the specified resolution date. Any alterations in the method used by FiveThirtyEight to compute its statistics will not influence the resolution of this market.

This market will finalize based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It is possible that this market will not reach a conclusion until the July 20 data is available. Should there be no data for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the closest preceding figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate wins will not be taken into account.

para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is evaluated to have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is considered to have a better chance of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the same forecast for July 19, 2024. In the event that both candidates are projected to have equal chances, the outcome will be a 50-50 result.

The source for this resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, particularly focusing on the values shown by the blue and red trend lines for the specified resolution date. This market will finalize based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It is possible that this market will not reach a conclusion until the July 20 data is available. It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate wins will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro and will 538 Project Trump as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market resolves YES if BOTH of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, confirmed by Kamala herself, and (b) Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. 

The market resolves NO if either: (a) Kamala Harris announces anyone else as her running mate, or (b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024.

For Kamala Harris' VP pick, the resolution source is Kamala Harris' announcement. For the FiveThirtyEight projection, the resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris choose either Kelly or Shapiro as her running mate and will FiveThirtyEight indicate Trump as the frontrunner this Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will resolve to YES if BOTH of the following conditions are met: (a) Kamala Harris publicly announces her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, with confirmation from Kamala herself, and (b) according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024, Donald Trump has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden. 

The market will resolve to NO if either: (a) Kamala Harris selects someone other than Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her running mate, or (b) Joe Biden is projected to have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024.

The resolution source for Kamala Harris' vice-presidential selection is her official announcement. For the FiveThirtyEight projection, the resolution source is the FiveThirtyEight forecast for the 2024 presidential election, specifically referencing the data shown by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris select either Kelly or Shapiro as her VP and will FiveThirtyEight indicate Trump as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market resolves YES if BOTH of the following conditions are met: (a) Kamala Harris declares her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, with confirmation from Kamala herself, and (b) FiveThirtyEight's election forecast on July 19, 2024, shows Donald Trump with a greater likelihood of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden. 

The market resolves NO if either: (a) Kamala Harris names someone other than Kelly or Shapiro as her running mate, or (b) FiveThirtyEight's forecast on July 19, 2024, indicates Joe Biden has a higher chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump.

For the resolution regarding Kamala Harris' VP selection, the source is her announcement. For the FiveThirtyEight forecast, the resolution source is the 2024 presidential election forecast from FiveThirtyEight, particularly the data represented by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris choose either Kelly or Shapiro as her vice president, and will FiveThirtyEight show Trump as the leading candidate this Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will resolve to YES if BOTH of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) Kamala Harris announces her selection for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro prior to August 7th, with her own confirmation, and (b) FiveThirtyEight's election forecast on July 19, 2024, indicates that Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden. 

The market will resolve to NO if either: (a) Kamala Harris selects someone other than Kelly or Shapiro as her running mate, or (b) FiveThirtyEight's forecast on July 19, 2024, shows that Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump.

For the resolution concerning Kamala Harris' vice presidential choice, the source will be her announcement. For the FiveThirtyEight forecast, the source of resolution will be the 2024 presidential election forecast from FiveThirtyEight, specifically the data depicted by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) 538 Project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, or (b) Kamala Harris pick Kelly or Shapiro as VP?
question.body:
(a) 538 Project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024: This will occur if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19. Changes in methodology will not affect resolution. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, this will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

(b) Kamala Harris pick Kelly or Shapiro as VP: This will occur if Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th. The resolution will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala Harris herself.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following will take place: (a) 538 forecasts Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024, or (b) Kamala Harris selects Kelly or Shapiro as her vice-presidential candidate?
para_P.body:
(a) 538 forecasting Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024: This will happen if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the figures shown by the blue and red trend lines for that date. Methodology changes will not influence the resolution. If no data points for July 19 are available by July 22, the resolution will rely on the closest previous data to July 19.

(b) Kamala Harris selecting Kelly or Shapiro as her vice-presidential candidate: This will occur if Kamala Harris reveals her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro prior to August 7th. The resolution will await confirmation of the pick directly from Kamala Harris.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either (a) Biden is projected as the frontrunner by 538 on July 19, 2024, or (b) Kamala Harris selects Kelly or Shapiro as her vice-presidential candidate?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden being projected as the frontrunner by 538 on July 19, 2024: This will take place if Joe Biden is forecasted to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election prediction for that date. The outcome will be determined by FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election, particularly the values shown by the blue and red trend lines for July 19. Any changes in methodology will not influence the resolution. If there are no data points for July 19 available by July 22, the resolution will rely on the closest preceding figures to July 19.

(b) Kamala Harris selecting Kelly or Shapiro as her vice-presidential candidate: This will happen if Kamala Harris makes an announcement regarding her choice for running mate, naming either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, prior to August 7th. The resolution will be contingent upon confirmation of the selection by Kamala Harris herself.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that either (a) Biden is identified as the leading candidate by 538 on July 19, 2024, or (b) Kamala Harris chooses Kelly or Shapiro for her vice-presidential role?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden being identified as the leading candidate by 538 on July 19, 2024: This will occur if Joe Biden is anticipated to have a higher likelihood of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for that date. The result will be determined by FiveThirtyEight's prediction for the 2024 presidential election, especially the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19. Any alterations in methodology will not affect the outcome. If there are no data points for July 19 available by July 22, the outcome will depend on the closest prior figures to July 19.

(b) Kamala Harris choosing Kelly or Shapiro for her vice-presidential role: This will take place if Kamala Harris makes a statement regarding her selection for running mate, naming either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, before August 7th. The outcome will be based on confirmation of the choice by Kamala Harris herself.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Poland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Poland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Poland fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Is Poland set to reach the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Poland fails to qualify, the question will be answered with a **No**.

para_P.title: Will Poland participate in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This question will result in a **Yes** if Poland competes in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. On the other hand, if Poland does not qualify, the answer will be a **No**.

question.title: Will Latvia qualify and Poland fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Poland either does not participate in a Semi-final or is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Grand Final. question.body:

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics (b) A swimmer does not win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
(a) The question about the same nation winning more than one women's team sport resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as Yes.

(b) The question about a swimmer not winning the most gold medals resolves as Yes if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does not compete in the swimming events.

para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry regarding whether a single country wins multiple women's team sports is answered with No if gold medals in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo - are claimed by women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC). If not, then that same NOC must have won at least two of these competitions, leading to a Yes response.

(b) The question concerning whether a swimmer does not claim the most gold medals is answered affirmatively if the competitor with the greatest number of gold medals at the 2024 Olympics does not participate in swimming.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) A single country secures victories in more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics (b) A swimmer fails to achieve the highest number of gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry regarding whether a single nation wins multiple women's team sports will be answered with No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) capture gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Conversely, if the same NOC has claimed at least two of these events, the answer will be Yes.

(b) The question concerning whether a swimmer does not win the most gold medals will be answered with Yes if the individual who secures the most gold medals at the 2024 Olympics does not participate in swimming events.

para_P.title: Could it occur that both of the following scenarios take place: (a) One nation achieves triumphs in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics (b) A swimmer does not earn the greatest number of gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) The question of whether a single country can secure victories in several women's team sports will receive a No if women's teams from eight separate National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. On the other hand, if the same NOC has won at least two of these events, the response will be Yes.

(b) The inquiry about whether a swimmer does not achieve the highest number of gold medals will be answered with Yes if the athlete who obtains the most gold medals at the 2024 Olympics is not involved in swimming competitions.

question.title: Will either a swimmer win the most gold medals or the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. (b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. The question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in these eight team sports.

para_P.title: Will a swimmer secure the highest number of gold medals or will a single nation achieve victory in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry is answered with **Yes** if either of the subsequent events takes place: (a) The competitor who accumulates the most gold medals at the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming events. (b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) claims gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. The answer will be **No** if women's teams from eight distinct NOCs win gold in these eight team sports.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a swimmer to secure the highest number of gold medals or for a single country to achieve victories in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry is answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) The competitor who earns the most gold medals at the 2024 Olympic Games is a participant in the swimming competitions. (b) The identical National Olympic Committee (NOC) claims gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. The response will be **No** if gold medals are won by women's teams from eight distinct NOCs in these eight team sports.

para_P.title: Can a swimmer achieve the greatest number of gold medals or can one nation triumph in several women's team sports during the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This question is responded to with **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs: (a) The athlete who secures the highest number of gold medals at the 2024 Olympic Games is involved in swimming events. (b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: soccer, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. The answer will be **No** if gold medals are captured by women's teams from eight different NOCs in these eight team sports.

question.title: Will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Czechia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Czechia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Czechia does not advance, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) At least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024 (b) Nvidia's market capitalization is less than or equal to Apple's on July 17, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Politico reports that two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November. Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts. This resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. This requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this resolves NO.

(b) This resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is less than or equal to that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following two events happen: (a) A minimum of five named Democratic House Members or US Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th, 2024 (b) Nvidia's market value is at most equal to Apple's on July 17, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) According to reports from Politico, two members from safe seats have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local news that they believe Biden's chances of winning in November are slim. Behind the scenes, the situation is even more intense. There are several drafts of letters being shared among House Democrats, and at least one draft is said to request Biden to end his campaign, as per five sources familiar with the matter. This will be marked as YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collectively ask Joe Biden to think about halting his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could take the form of a signed letter, similar to the reports mentioned earlier, or it could occur through a group meeting with Biden where they collectively request him to withdraw. It is essential that all five individuals are part of the same group communication. Merely five individuals separately expressing their belief to reporters that Biden should exit is insufficient for a YES outcome. Any reports of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden urging him to step aside will not count unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the deadline. In cases where names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, the resolution will lean towards NO. If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, the outcome will be NO.

(b) This will be marked YES if, on July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is less than or equal to that of Apple, as reported by Companies Market Cap, when verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his refusal of the Democratic Party's presidential nomination before July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

To achieve a **Yes** answer, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's presidential nomination for the 2024 election.

If no such clear statement is issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be answered with **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will refuse the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce prior to July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign provides a clear, public, official declaration stating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** outcome, the statement must be unequivocal and definitive: it should remove any chance that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not released before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP (b) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

(b) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President: This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **No** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

This question will be answered with a **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met after the 2024 European Parliament elections: (a) The Greens–EFA party achieves the most seats, and (b) The GUE/NGL party does not achieve the most seats. If the Greens–EFA party is tied for the most seats, condition (a) remains satisfied. If the GUE/NGL party is tied for the most seats, condition (b) is not satisfied.

This question will be resolved based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media reports.

question.title: Will either GUE/NGL or Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either the GUE/NGL or the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. The resolution is based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Which political group will secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections: GUE/NGL or Greens–EFA?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if either the GUE/NGL or the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. In the event of a tie between two groups for the most seats, the outcome will also be **Yes**. The determination is based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.

para_P.title: Which political group, GUE/NGL or Greens–EFA, will secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either the GUE/NGL or the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. In the event of a tie in seat numbers between two groups, the answer will also be **Yes**. The determination will rely on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media sources.

para_P.title: Which political faction will achieve the most seats in the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, GUE/NGL or Greens–EFA?
para_P.body: This question will receive a **Yes** answer if either the GUE/NGL or the Greens–EFA political group obtains the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. A **Yes** will also be given in the case of a tie in the number of seats between the two factions. The conclusion will be based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media outlets.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than an unspecified Democrat, will he secure at least 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls conducted on Manifold are set to conclude on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to cast their votes alongside Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a non-specific Democrat on a similar hypothetical ballot.

Public sentiment surveys frequently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat surveyed in these hypothetical scenarios either leads or is within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader public?

This market will be deemed YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or more when both polls conclude.

The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is determined by the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the result will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will remain active until their designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

This market will be considered a YES if the share of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls conclude.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Other)). The outcome is YES if the result from poll 1 minus the result from poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the result will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.body: Should Biden withdraw or be unable to proceed with the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

para_P.title: Could Biden exit the race before July 20?
para_P.body: If Biden decides to step down or is unable to continue his campaign by midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will be settled with a yes. If he remains in the race, the market will be settled with a no.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro and Biden not drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, and (2) Joe Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race until after July 20 midnight Eastern Time. 

The question resolves to NO if either Kamala Harris announces anyone else as her running mate or if Joe Biden drops out before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. 

For Kamala Harris' VP pick, the decision must be confirmed by Kamala herself before August 7th. For Joe Biden, he must remain in the race past July 20th midnight Eastern Time. 

Comment if you have any questions or news 💙

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris select either Kelly or Shapiro as her running mate, and will Biden remain in the race until after July 20?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Kamala Harris declares her choice for vice-presidential candidate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, and (2) Joe Biden does not withdraw and is able to stay in the race until after July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. 

This inquiry will be deemed negative if either Kamala Harris names someone else as her running mate or if Joe Biden withdraws before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. 

For Kamala Harris' vice-presidential selection, the decision must be made public by her before August 7th. For Joe Biden, he must persist in the race beyond July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. 

Feel free to comment if you have any inquiries or updates 💙

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party expected?
para_P.body: Determines YES if a debate occurs among prospective Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Determines NO in all other cases.

para_P.body: This resolves to YES if a debate occurs among prospective Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It resolves to NO in all other cases.

para_P.body: This will be considered YES if a debate takes place among potential Democratic candidates (including Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be deemed NO in all other scenarios.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be president by Friday and will there be no more Democratic party presidential debates?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting, and (2) there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves "No" if either or both conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Kamala Harris to assume the presidency by Friday without any further debates among Democratic presidential candidates?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, according to official sources from the US government or a consensus of reliable news reports, and (2) there are no debates held among potential Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be deemed "No" if either or both of these criteria are not satisfied.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Kamala Harris will assume the presidency by Friday and that there will be no further debates for the Democratic party's presidential candidates?

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average exceed 3 but not surpass 4?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump compared to Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would translate to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as illustrated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when it is reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would translate to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.body:

In this context, a positive number reflects a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates that Biden is ahead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

question.body:
(a) Vivek Ramaswamy must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) On July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden must be less than or equal to 3 points or greater than 4 points. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. The value is determined by the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

question.body:

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This question resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This question resolves as Yes if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 (b) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by 0.1% or less in July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by 0.1% or less in July 2024: Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by 0.1% or less compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August 2024 (b) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI rises by 0.1% or less in July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as the Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by 0.1% or less in July 2024: Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase of 0.1% or less compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the precise (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) Biden to be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024 (b) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI rise to be 0.1% or lower in July 2024?

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls conducted by Manifold are set to conclude on July 6. One poll presents respondents with a choice including Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other includes a generic Democrat.

Public sentiment surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error range, whereas all other Democrats surveyed hypothetically either lead or are within the error margin. Do the Manifold participants reflect the views of the broader population?

This market will be marked YES if Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Biden does not drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race until July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. If Biden drops out before this time, the question will resolve as "No".

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following happen: (a) Donald Trump is disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Biden remains in the race without withdrawing before July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be accepted for resolution. The inquiry does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may occur after the specified date. It solely concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry resolves negatively.

(b) Biden does not withdraw and is capable of continuing his campaign until July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time. If Biden withdraws before this deadline, the inquiry will resolve as "No".

The inquiry will resolve as "No" if either or both of these criteria are not fulfilled.
