question.title: Will Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Inflection will release a report detailing the findings from an independent red-team evaluation of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Inflection, this question will be considered **YES** if they make available a *public* report by June 30, 2024, which includes the outcomes from a safety red-team assessment conducted by an *external* entity on one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Inflection will release a report detailing findings from an external red-teaming of their models regarding safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Inflection, this inquiry will be considered **YES** if, prior to June 30, 2024, they issue a *public* report containing the results from an *external* entity assessing the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Could Inflection publish a report outlining the results of an independent red-teaming evaluation of their models concerning safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be marked as **YES** for Inflection if they release a *public* report before June 30, 2024, that includes the findings from an *external* organization reviewing the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT will be generally available in the European Union, and (b) Inflection will not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety?
question.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if both of the following conditions are met by June 30, 2024:

(a) [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to certain groups (e.g., minors), this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively if the service is substantially the same, even if the name or website changes.

(b) Inflection does not publish a *public* report with results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

The question resolves as **NO** if either condition (a) or condition (b) is not met by the specified date.

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT will be accessible to the general public in the European Union, and (b) Inflection will refrain from releasing a report that presents findings from external safety assessments of their models?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **YES** if both of the following criteria are satisfied by June 30, 2024:

(a) On June 30, 2024, [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU. "Widely accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (possibly requiring a fee). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations, or to particular demographics (e.g., minors), it will still be considered positive, provided that over 50% of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for engaging with GPT models, and it will be viewed positively if the service remains largely unchanged, even if the name or website undergoes alterations.

(b) Inflection does not issue a *public* report detailing the outcomes from an *external* entity assessing the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

The inquiry will be regarded as **NO** if either condition (a) or condition (b) fails to be met by the designated date.

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will both of these events take place: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT will be accessible to everyone in the European Union, and (b) Inflection will refrain from releasing a report that includes findings from external safety assessments of their models?
para_P.body:
This inquiry is answered with **YES** if both of the following criteria are satisfied by June 30, 2024:

(a) On June 30, 2024, [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU. "Accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without relying on a VPN (it may require a payment). If it is not available in specific EU nations, or not available to certain demographics (e.g., minors), it will still resolve positively, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" refers to the main web interface for engaging with GPT models, and it resolves positively if the service is largely unchanged, even if the name or website undergoes alterations.

(b) Inflection does not issue a *public* report containing results from an *external* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

The inquiry resolves as **NO** if either condition (a) or condition (b) is unmet by the given date.

para_P.title: By the end of June 2024, will the following two occurrences happen: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT will be available to all individuals in the European Union, and (b) Inflection will not publish a report that features findings from outside evaluations of their models?
para_P.body:
This question is considered answered with **YES** if both of the following conditions are fulfilled by the end of June 2024:

(a) On June 30, 2024, [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is available to the general public within the EU. "Available" means that the typical situation for residents in the EU is that they can utilize it without depending on a VPN (it may necessitate a fee). If it is inaccessible in certain EU countries, or not available to specific groups (e.g., minors), it will still be deemed positive as long as over 50% of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" refers to the primary web interface for interacting with GPT models, and it is considered positive if the service remains largely the same, even if the name or website changes.

(b) Inflection does not release a *public* report that includes results from an *external* assessment of the safety of any of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

The question resolves as **NO** if either condition (a) or condition (b) is not met by the specified date.

question.title: Will either Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, or OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if at least one of the following occurs by the specified dates:

(a) Inflection publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

(b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. It resolves positively even if unavailable in certain EU countries or to certain demographics, as long as >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, resolving positively if the service remains substantially the same even if rebranded.

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will Inflection release a report detailing the findings from external evaluations of their models regarding safety, or will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the general public in the European Union?
para_P.body:
This inquiry is answered with **YES** if at least one of the following happens by the stated deadlines:

(a) Inflection issues a *publicly accessible* report containing the findings from an *independent* assessment of the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

(b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Widely accessible" indicates that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is to have access without needing a VPN, potentially involving a fee. It counts as a positive outcome even if it is not available in specific EU nations or to certain groups, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it. The term "ChatGPT" pertains to the general web interface for engaging with GPT models, and it is considered a positive outcome if the service remains largely unchanged, even if it undergoes rebranding.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Inflection will release a report detailing the findings from an external safety assessment of their models by June 30, 2024, or that OpenAI's ChatGPT will be accessible to the general public in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **YES** if at least one of the following events takes place by the given deadlines:

(a) Inflection publishes a *publicly available* report outlining the results from an *independent* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

(b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is made generally accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally accessible" indicates that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN, although it may require payment. It will be considered a positive outcome even if it is not available in specific EU countries or to certain groups, as long as more than 50% of the population can access it. The term "ChatGPT" refers to the overall web interface for engaging with GPT models, and it resolves positively if the service remains largely unchanged even if it undergoes rebranding.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Inflection will issue a report summarizing the results from an external safety review of their models by June 30, 2024, or that OpenAI's ChatGPT will be available to the public in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if at least one of the following scenarios occurs by the specified deadlines:

(a) Inflection releases a *publicly accessible* report detailing the outcomes from an *independent* assessment of the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

(b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the typical situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN, though it may involve a fee. It will be regarded as a favorable result even if it is not accessible in certain EU nations or to specific demographics, as long as more than half of the population can access it. The term "ChatGPT" pertains to the overall web interface for interacting with GPT models, and it will be deemed successful if the service remains mostly unchanged even if it undergoes rebranding.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Scotland will conduct an officially recognized referendum on independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if a referendum takes place in Scotland concerning its independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum occurs before May 3, 2024. This referendum can be classified as an "advisory" referendum; it is not required for the referendum to possess any legal binding authority.

A referendum will not be regarded as resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum where the UK government has refused to grant permission for the vote, nor by a vote organized by civil society groups. A referendum must be recognized as having the approval of the London government.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of Scotland conducting an official referendum on independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:

This referendum may be classified as an "advisory" referendum; it is not required for the referendum to possess any legally binding consequences.

A referendum will not be recognized as resolved if it is a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum where permission for the vote has been denied by the UK government, nor by a vote arranged by civil society organizations. For a referendum to be valid, it must have the approval of the London government.

For a referendum to be valid, it must receive approval from the London government.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement confirming that Joe Biden will not pursue nor accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear-cut and definitive: it must eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a conclusive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement declaring that Joe Biden will neither pursue nor accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will publicly announce prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign provides a distinct, public, and official communication stating that Joe Biden will not seek or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election.

For a **Yes** outcome, the statement must be unequivocal and definitive: it should remove any chance that Biden would agree to the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a definitive announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. **Russia's Control of Chasiv Yar**: When accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:
   - Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
   - Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Assessed Russian Control
   - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

   The question will resolve as **No** with respect to this condition if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:
   - Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
   - Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

2. **Joe Biden's Announcement**: Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

   To qualify for a **Yes** resolution with respect to this condition, the absence of such a statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: there should be no room for the possibility that Biden has announced he would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

   If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this condition will resolve as **No**.

The overall question will resolve as **Yes** only if both conditions are satisfied as described above. If either condition resolves as **No**, the overall question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following events will happen: (a) Russia will take control of Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden will not publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

1. **Russia's Control of Chasiv Yar**: When reviewed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as belonging to any of these categories:
   - Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine
   - Evaluated Russian Gains in the Recent 24 Hours
   - Evaluated Russian Authority
   - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
   - Any other categories introduced by ISW that signify Russian authority over the area.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden decide to withdraw, will a trustworthy news organization report on it a minimum of 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if a major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provides coverage of the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement of withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage from local news, conspiracy sites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not be adequate.

This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: In the event that Joe Biden withdraws, will a trustworthy news organization report the event no less than 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question is answered affirmatively if a major and credible news source such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement regarding the withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage by local news, conspiracy sites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not be adequate.

If President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention, this market will be deemed N/A.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden decides to step down, will a reliable news outlet inform the public at least 6 hours in advance?
para_P.body:
This inquiry receives a positive response if a prominent and reputable news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post announces the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation no less than 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially declares his withdrawal through a letter, speech, or similar means.

Reports from local news outlets, conspiracy websites, or remarks from individual users on Manifold will not suffice.

Should President Joe Biden remain in office until after the National Democratic Convention concludes, this market will be considered N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) If Joe Biden drops out, no reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(2) This question resolves YES if no big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024; (b) Francis Suarez not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) FiveThirtyEight will project Joe Biden as having a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to their election forecast for July 19, 2024. The resolution will be based on the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast website. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this will resolve 50-50. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used.
(b) Francis Suarez will not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The question will resolve as Yes if any other candidate is selected. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Nvidia's market capitalization is not larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) ISS advises voting against Elon Musk's pay package or Kimbal Musk's re-election, and (b) the linked market gets fewer than 377 traders by July 15?
question.body:
(a) The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

(b) Resolves YES if the market embedded above has fewer than 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) ISS recommends opposing Elon Musk's compensation plan or Kimbal Musk's reappointment, and (b) the referenced market has less than 377 participants by July 15?
para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly urging Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's compensation package during the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR to reject Kimbal Musk's re-election to the Tesla board. If not, the inquiry will resolve as **No**.

(b) It will resolve as YES if the aforementioned market has fewer than 377 participants before it closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will resolve as NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following take place: (a) ISS recommends against Elon Musk's compensation plan or Kimbal Musk's re-election, and (b) the associated market has less than 377 participants by July 15?

If not, the resolution will be **No**.

(b) This will resolve as YES if the aforementioned market has fewer than 377 participants prior to market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will resolve as NO otherwise.

If this does not occur, the outcome will be **No**.

(b) This will be determined as YES if the previously mentioned market has less than 377 participants before the market closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will be determined as NO in other cases.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the gap between Trump's polling and Biden's polling exceed 2 but not surpass 3, based on 538's national average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved by examining Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be treated as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in support for Trump compared to Biden exceed 2 but not go beyond 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the difference in support for Donald Trump over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, which will be reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, resulting in a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the gap in support for Trump relative to Biden be greater than 2 but less than 3, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved based on the disparity in support for Donald Trump compared to Joe Biden as reflected by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, which will be assessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive value denotes a lead for Trump, while a negative value indicates that Biden is in front. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, resulting in a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, and (b) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be greater Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, and (b) Trump's margin over Biden will either be 2 or less, or exceed 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) The resolution of this question will depend on data from the St. Louis Fed found here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The figure reported for July 20, 2024 must surpass the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

(b) This question will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive number indicates a Trump lead, while a negative number indicates a Biden lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will show a Year-over-Year increase on July 20, 2024, and (b) Trump's margin over Biden will be at most 2 or exceed 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) The resolution of this question will depend on data from the St. Louis Fed available here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The figure for July 20, 2024 must surpass the figure recorded on July 20, 2023.

(b) This question will resolve based on Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number indicates a Trump advantage, while a negative number indicates Biden is leading. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Will it be confirmed that both of the following events occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will reflect a Year-over-Year rise on July 20, 2024, and (b) Trump's lead over Biden will be at most 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) The answer to this inquiry will rely on statistics from the St. Louis Fed found here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The value for July 20, 2024 must exceed the value recorded on July 20, 2023.

(b) This question will be resolved based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as represented in the chart for July 15, 2024, when analyzed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number signifies a Trump lead, while a negative number indicates Biden is ahead. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which is interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

para_P.title: Will Team USA secure gold medals in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball events at the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will be answered affirmatively if both the men's and women's teams from the United States achieve gold medals. It will be answered negatively if either team finishes in a position other than first place.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the United States to secure gold medals in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball events at the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: The outcome is Yes if Team USA achieves gold in both categories. The outcome is No if either the men's or women's team finishes in a position other than first place.

para_P.title: Can the United States win gold medals in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball competitions at the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: The result will be Yes if Team USA wins gold in both events. The result will be No if either the men's or women's team does not finish in first place.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals (b) The United States fails to win gold in either Men's or Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (2) Either the United States men's or women's basketball team places anywhere other than gold at the Paris Olympics. 

It resolves **No** if either the Philadelphia 76ers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals or if the United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The Philadelphia 76ers become champions of the 2024 NBA Finals (b) The United States does not secure a gold medal in either Men's or Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with **Yes** if both of these conditions are satisfied: (1) The Philadelphia 76ers are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, as confirmed by [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (2) Either the United States men's or women's basketball team finishes in a position other than first place at the Paris Olympics. 

The answer is **No** if the Philadelphia 76ers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals or if the United States takes home gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The Philadelphia 76ers become champions of the 2024 NBA Finals (b) The United States does not secure a gold medal in either Men's or Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
The answer is **Yes** if both of these conditions are satisfied: (1) The Philadelphia 76ers are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, as stated by [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (2) Either the men's or women's basketball team of the United States finishes in a position that is not gold at the Paris Olympics. 

The answer is **No** if the Philadelphia 76ers fail to win the 2024 NBA Finals or if the United States achieves gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Philadelphia 76ers are crowned champions of the 2024 NBA Finals (b) The United States does not win a gold medal in either Men's or Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
The response is **Yes** if both of these criteria are met: (1) The Philadelphia 76ers are recognized as the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, as reported by [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (2) Either the men's or women's basketball team from the United States does not finish in first place at the Paris Olympics. 

The response is **No** if the Philadelphia 76ers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals or if the United States secures gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Team USA wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics (b) The Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) Team USA wins gold medals in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball events at the Paris Olympics. (b) The Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves **No** if neither condition is satisfied.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following to happen: (a) Team USA secures gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics (b) The Philadelphia 76ers claim victory in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) Team USA achieves gold medals in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball competitions at the Paris Olympics. (b) The Philadelphia 76ers are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be resolved as **No** if neither scenario takes place.

para_P.title: Is it possible for either of these events to take place: (a) Team USA secures gold in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball competitions at the Paris Olympics, or (b) The Philadelphia 76ers emerge victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) Team USA achieves gold in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball tournaments at the Paris Olympics. (b) The Philadelphia 76ers are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be deemed **No** if neither scenario takes place.

para_P.title: Can either of the following scenarios happen: (a) Team USA wins gold medals in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball events at the Paris Olympics, or (b) The Philadelphia 76ers claim victory in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following situations occurs: (a) Team USA secures gold in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball competitions at the Paris Olympics. (b) The Philadelphia 76ers are announced as the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be considered **No** if neither of these situations occurs.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple voting rounds in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot is necessary, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If a single ballot suffices, then the outcome will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will the Democrats have to hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with a **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires several rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to formally choose its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is necessary, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Democrats do not have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, this condition will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(b) This condition resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this condition resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20, 2024, and (b) the Democrats avoid a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Reference link: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If there are 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to step down at any time before midnight Central Time on July 20, this condition will be considered true. If not, it will be deemed false.

(b) This condition will be marked as **Yes** if the Democratic Party can nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election without needing more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot. If it takes more than one ballot, then this condition will be marked as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following two events to happen: (a) at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign before July 20, 2024, and (b) the Democrats avoid a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Reference: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If, before midnight Central Time on July 20, there are indications of 10 or more Democratic Senators urging Biden to step down, this condition will be considered true. If not, it will be deemed false.

(b) This condition will be marked as **Yes** if the Democratic Party can nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election without needing more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot. If more than one ballot is necessary, this condition will be marked as **No**.

para_P.title: Could both of the following scenarios occur: (a) a minimum of 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden's resignation prior to July 20, 2024, and (b) the Democrats successfully avoid a contested convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Reference: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If there are signs of 10 or more Democratic Senators advocating for Biden to resign before midnight Central Time on July 20, this condition will be regarded as true. Otherwise, it will be considered false.

(b) This condition will be assessed as **Yes** if the Democratic Party can select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election without requiring more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot. If more than one ballot is needed, this condition will be evaluated as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this resolves as **No**.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20: This resolves as **Yes** if at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024 (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to step aside prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
(a) Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024: This is determined as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this is determined as **No**.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to step aside prior to July 20: This is determined as **Yes** if at any time before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times reports 10 or more Democratic Senators urging Biden to step aside. Otherwise, it is determined as **No**.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following happens: (a) Democrats face a brokered convention in 2024 (b) At least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
(a) Democrats face a brokered convention in 2024: This will be considered **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting during its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, it will be marked as **No**.

(b) At least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20: This will be marked as **Yes** if, at any time before midnight on July 20 Central Time, the New York Times reports that 10 or more Democratic Senators are calling for Biden to step down. If not, it will be marked as **No**.

para_P.title: Could there be a chance that one of the following occurs: (a) Democrats encounter a brokered convention in 2024 (b) A minimum of 10 Democratic Senators request Biden to step down prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
(a) Democrats encounter a brokered convention in 2024: This will be considered **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting during its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, it will be marked as **No**.

(b) A minimum of 10 Democratic Senators request Biden to step down prior to July 20: This will be marked as **Yes** if, at any point before midnight on July 20 Central Time, the New York Times reports that 10 or more Democratic Senators are calling for Biden to resign. If not, it will be marked as **No**.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be invoked to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This question resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is incapable of fulfilling the powers and responsibilities of his office" and subsequently appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP lawmaker has requested Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) enacts Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is not relevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the office of the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden activating section 3 of the 25th amendment is not considered.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to use the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unable to perform his duties under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
This will be answered with YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another suitable authority), implements Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to carry out the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not pertinent to this question.

Biden resigning from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is excluded. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment is not taken into account.

Context: A Republican lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body: Resolves YES if both of the following occur: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. (b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of any incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count towards the second condition. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count towards the second condition.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday and remain unrecognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body: This resolves to YES if both of the following take place: (a) An official declaration of Joe Biden's passing is made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. (b) The Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) do not activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of any incapacity is irrelevant to this question. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count towards the second condition. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count towards the second condition.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away prior to Saturday without being officially recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body: This resolves to YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) An official declaration of Joe Biden's death is made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. (b) The Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) do not activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of any incapacity is irrelevant to this question. Joe Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not fulfill the second condition. Additionally, Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not satisfy the second condition.

para_P.title: Could Joe Biden die before Saturday without being formally deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body: This results in a YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) An official announcement of Joe Biden's death occurs before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. (b) The Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another suitable authority), does not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of any incapacity is not relevant to this inquiry. Joe Biden departing from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not meet the second criterion. Furthermore, Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not fulfill the second criterion.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024? (b) Joe Biden die before July 26th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden die before July 26th, 2024: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that one of the following will take place: (a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024? (b) Joe Biden passes away before July 26th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacitation is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not applicable.

(b) Joe Biden passes away before July 26th, 2024: Resolves YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Biden is deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024? (b) Joe Biden passes away before July 26th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden is deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent group) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not considered.

(b) Joe Biden passes away before July 26th, 2024: Resolves YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Could one of the following events occur: (a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024? (b) Joe Biden dies prior to July 26th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant group) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and permits the Vice President to assume the role of President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not affect this inquiry. Biden resigning, passing away, or similar does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not taken into account.

(b) Joe Biden dies before July 26th, 2024: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

para_P.title: Is it possible for 24 or more world records to be set during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the total count of world records established at the Paris Olympics reaches 24 or exceeds that number.

para_P.title: Is it possible for 24 or more world records to be set at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the total number of world records established during the Paris Olympics reaches 24 or exceeds it.

para_P.title: Could there be 24 or more world records achieved at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the overall count of world records set during the Paris Olympics is 24 or higher.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 and fewer than 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if both of the following conditions are met: (a) France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) fewer than 24 world records are broken during the Paris Olympics. The question will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

For condition (a), the medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

For condition (b), the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics must be fewer than 24.

para_P.title: Will France achieve a Top 5 finish while fewer than 24 world records are set during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) France secures a position in the top 5 (ties are counted as positive) at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) less than 24 world records are established throughout the Paris Olympics. The inquiry will be deemed unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

For criterion (a), the medal standings are determined by tallying the total medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them according to:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie for 1st) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie for 2nd) Total Bronze Medals

For criterion (b), the total world records established during the Paris Olympics must be fewer than 24.

para_P.title: Will France finish among the top 5 and will less than 24 world records be set at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled: (a) France finishes in the top 5 (ties are counted as positive) at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) less than 24 world records are established during the Paris Olympics. The inquiry will be deemed unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

For criterion (a), the medal standings are determined by summing the total medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them based on:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (In the event of a tie at 1) Number of Silver Medals
3. (In the event of a tie at 2) Number of Bronze Medals

For criterion (b), the tally of world records established during the Paris Olympics must be below 24.

para_P.title: Will France rank in the top 5 and will fewer than 24 world records be achieved at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered positively if both of the following conditions are met: (a) France ranks within the top 5 (ties are considered positive) at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) fewer than 24 world records are set during the Paris Olympics. The question will be regarded as unclear if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

For condition (a), the medal rankings are determined by calculating the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering them according to:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie at 1) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie at 2) Total Bronze Medals

For condition (b), the number of world records set during the Paris Olympics must be less than 24.

question.title: Will either at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics or France place in the Top 5?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater. (b) France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 24 world records be set during the 2024 Paris Olympics, or will France secure a position in the Top 5?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following conditions is met: (a) At least 24 world records are established during the Paris Olympics. (b) France achieves a Top 5 finish (ties are counted positively) at the 2024 Olympics. If the Olympics do not occur in 2024, the resolution will be uncertain. The medal standings are determined by tallying the total medals earned by each participating nation and sorting them by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (In case of a tie for first) Number of Silver Medals 3. (In case of a tie for second) Number of Bronze Medals.

para_P.title: Is it possible for either a minimum of 24 world records to be set at the 2024 Paris Olympics or for France to finish in the Top 5?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) The total number of world records established during the Paris Olympics reaches 24 or more. (b) France secures a position in the top 5 (ties are considered as positive outcomes) at the 2024 Olympics. If the Olympics do not occur in 2024, the resolution will be uncertain. The medal standings are determined by tallying the overall medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them based on: 1. Total Gold Medals 2. (In case of a tie for 1st) Total Silver Medals 3. (In case of a tie for 2nd) Total Bronze Medals.

para_P.title: Can at least 24 world records be achieved at the 2024 Paris Olympics, or will France place in the Top 5?
para_P.body: This question will receive a response of **Yes** if any of the following is true: (a) The number of world records set during the Paris Olympics is 24 or more. (b) France finishes among the top 5 (ties are counted as favorable outcomes) in the 2024 Olympics. If the Olympics do not take place in 2024, the answer will be uncertain. The standings for medals are calculated by summing the total medals won by each country and ranking them as follows: 1. Total Gold Medals 2. (If tied for 1st) Total Silver Medals 3. (If tied for 2nd) Total Bronze Medals.

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024, and (b) the Pandemic Agreement is not approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following are true:

1. Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

2. During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is not approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) OpenAI makes a public commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle prior to July 1, 2024, and (b) the Pandemic Agreement does not receive approval at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if they fail to qualify, the resolution will be **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. If they fail to qualify, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will Cyprus qualify and Malta fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Cyprus does not qualify or Malta qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

If either Cyprus fails to advance or Malta does advance, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Cyprus to advance while Malta does not make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Cyprus competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Malta competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Should either Cyprus fail to qualify or Malta succeed, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

para_P.title: Can Cyprus move forward while Malta fails to reach the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Cyprus does not qualify or Malta qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Malta or Cyprus qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Malta or Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Malta or Cyprus secure a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either Malta or Cyprus competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither country qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Are Malta or Cyprus set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either Malta or Cyprus competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither of them qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will either Malta or Cyprus qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.
