question.title: Will the US government end its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD management before August 3, 2024, AND will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (1) Before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). (2) No definitive, public, official announcement is made by Joe Biden or his campaign prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, there must be no unambiguous and conclusive statement that leaves no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If both conditions are met, this question resolves as **Yes**. If either or both conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the US government will terminate its agreement with Verisign regarding the management of the .com TLD before August 3, 2024, AND that Joe Biden will refrain from announcing before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following take place: (1) The US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially cancels or concludes its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which acknowledges Verisign's oversight of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) prior to August 3, 2024. (2) There is no clear, public, official declaration made by Joe Biden or his campaign before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election. For a Yes resolution, there must be no clear and definitive statement that eliminates any possibility of Biden accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If both criteria are satisfied, this question will resolve as **Yes**. If either or both criteria are not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the US government will terminate its agreement with Verisign regarding the management of the .com TLD prior to August 3, 2024, AND will Joe Biden refrain from announcing by July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are satisfied: (1) The US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially ends or allows to expire its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign concerning Verisign's oversight of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024. (2) There is no clear, public, official declaration made by Joe Biden or his campaign before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. For a **Yes** resolution, it is essential that there is no unequivocal and definitive statement that eliminates any possibility of Biden accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If both requirements are fulfilled, this question will resolve as **Yes**. If either or both requirements are not fulfilled, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Could the US government end its contract with Verisign concerning the management of the .com TLD before August 3, 2024, AND will Joe Biden not make an announcement by July 15, 2024 that he will refuse the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body: This question will be answered as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially concludes or allows to lapse its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign regarding Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) prior to August 3, 2024. (2) There is no clear, public, official statement made by Joe Biden or his campaign before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not seek or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. For a **Yes** outcome, it is crucial that there is no unequivocal and definitive declaration that rules out any chance of Biden accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If both conditions are satisfied, this question will resolve as **Yes**. If either or both conditions are not satisfied, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (a) Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) The US government ends its agreement with Verisign for managing the .com TLD?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. 

(b) Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD).

para_P.title: Will either of the following take place prior to their set deadlines: (a) Joe Biden declares he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) The US government terminates its contract with Verisign for overseeing the .com TLD?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden make an announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be clear and definitive. 

(b) Will the US government conclude its agreement that permits Verisign to manage the official domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This will be considered Yes if, before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce officially cancels or allows to expire its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign that acknowledges Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD).

para_P.title: Will any of the following happen prior to their specified deadlines: (a) Joe Biden declares he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) The US government terminates its contract with Verisign for overseeing the .com TLD?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden publicly state before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official declaration that he will not seek or accept the nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive. 

(b) Will the US government conclude its agreement that permits Verisign to manage the official domain name registry for the .com TLD, prior to August 3, 2024? This will be considered Yes if, before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce officially cancels or ends its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign that acknowledges Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD).

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the following events will occur before their designated deadlines: (a) Joe Biden announces he will not seek the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) The US government ends its contract with Verisign for managing the .com TLD?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be marked as Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign provides a clear and public official statement that he will not seek or accept the nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unequivocal and definitive. 

(b) Will the US government terminate its agreement that allows Verisign to oversee the official domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This will be deemed Yes if, before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce officially cancels or concludes its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign that recognizes Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in support between Trump and Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4, based on 538's average of national polls?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which corresponds to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden fall between 2 and 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be settled based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as per 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, if the reported value indicates Trump is ahead by 2.4 points, this would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

para_P.title: Will the lead that Donald Trump has over Joe Biden on July 15, 2024, be between 2 and 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved by examining the margin by which Donald Trump leads Joe Biden according to 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as depicted in the chart for July 15, 2024, when assessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number reflects a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates Biden is leading. For example, if on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead by 2.4 points, this would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if at least one of the following occurs: (a) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) has a closing price under $100 on any day prior to July 31, or (b) the seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% compared to June 2024, utilizing the precise (not rounded) figure from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

para_P.title: Could Nvidia end up trading below $100 per share by July 31, or might the US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
para_P.body: This question will receive a YES response if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) has a closing price below $100 on any day before July 31, or (b) the seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 records a rise exceeding 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact (not rounded) figure from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

question.title: Will Norway qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Norway set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Norway competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Should Norway fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

para_P.title: Is Norway going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Norway takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Norway fails to qualify, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

para_P.title: Will Norway qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This question will result in a **Yes** if Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially acknowledged by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. On the other hand, if Norway does not qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Switzerland qualify and Norway fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (1) Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Norway does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Switzerland does not qualify or Norway qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Switzerland to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 while Norway does not?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Switzerland competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Norway fails to qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Switzerland does not advance or Norway successfully qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that Switzerland will make it to the Grand Final while Norway will not in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Switzerland competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Norway does not advance to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland fails to qualify or Norway qualifies, the outcome will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will Switzerland reach the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 while Norway does not?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Norway does not progress to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland does not qualify or Norway qualifies, the result will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Norway or Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Norway nor Switzerland qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Norway or Switzerland will make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Norway takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Switzerland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Norway nor Switzerland secures qualification, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Are Norway or Switzerland set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following conditions is met: (a) Norway competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Switzerland competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Norway nor Switzerland advances, the inquiry will be answered with **No**.

para_P.title: Will either Norway or Switzerland reach the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This question will receive a response of **Yes** if one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Norway nor Switzerland progresses, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

para_P.title: Will Chasiv Yar be under Russian control by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if, on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any of the following classifications:



- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Authority

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other classifications established by ISW that signify Russian control over the area



The inquiry will be marked as **No** if the area is not categorized under any of the classifications that show Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any other classifications established by ISW that signify Ukrainian control over the area or a lack of Russian control over the area.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if, upon review by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as falling under any of the subsequent classifications:



- Evaluated Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains in the Previous 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Control

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Russian control of the site



The inquiry will resolve as **No** if the site is not evaluated to be in any of the classifications denoting Russian control, which encompasses but is not limited to:

- Asserted Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any additional categories established by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the site or a lack of Russian control of the site.

para_P.title: Will Russia have control over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered as **Yes** if, upon assessment by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E classified under any of the following categories:

The question will be resolved as **No** if the area is not classified in any of the categories that signify Russian control, which includes but is not restricted to:

- Declared Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Recorded Ukrainian Resistance Actions

- Any other classifications introduced by ISW that suggest Ukrainian control of the area or a lack of Russian authority over it.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Russia not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. **Donald Trump Removal or Blockage:**
   - On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This removal or blockage must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. **Russian Control of Chasiv Yar:**
   - On June 1, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as not under any of the following categories: Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location. The question will resolve as "No" if the location is assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to: Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Russia not maintain authority over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if both of the subsequent conditions are satisfied:

1. **Trump's Exclusion from the Ballot:**
   - As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been formally excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This exclusion or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may happen after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred from a ballot and then reinstated, leading to him not being excluded from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

2. **Status of Chasiv Yar under Russian Control:**
   - On June 1, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map must indicate that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E do not fall under any of the following classifications: Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories established by ISW that signify Russian oversight of the area. The question will be answered with "No" if the area is categorized under any of the classifications that indicate Russian control, which includes but is not limited to: Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare, or any other classifications created by ISW that denote Ukrainian authority over the area or a lack of Russian control over the area.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not satisfied.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Russia not have dominance over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" only if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied:

1. **Exclusion or Barring of Donald Trump:**
   - As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially excluded or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This exclusion or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or credible news reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may happen after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and then reinstated such that as of July 15th he is not excluded or barred from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

2. **Russian Dominance Over Chasiv Yar:**
   - On June 1, 2024, when evaluated by Metaculus, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map reflects the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as not falling under any of the following classifications: Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other classifications established by ISW that denote Russian control of the area. The question will resolve as "No" if the area is classified under any categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to: Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare, or any other classifications created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the area or a lack of Russian control over the area.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these criteria are not fulfilled.

para_P.title: Could Donald Trump potentially be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Russia not exert control over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in support between Trump and Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the recorded value indicated Trump was 2.4 points in front of Biden, which would represent a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would translate to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 but less than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:

In this scenario, a positive number reflects a Trump lead, while a negative number indicates that Biden is ahead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

(2) Resolves **Yes** if the margin of Donald Trump over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as displayed in the chart for July 15, 2024, when verified by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is either less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3. A positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates Biden is ahead.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) A member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024. This is determined by the value reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

(b) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election that is greater than 2 and no more than 3. This will be determined by the figure shown on the graph for that date, as checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative number signifies a lead for Biden.

(b) A member of the Trump family is chosen as the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024. This encompasses Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but is at most 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average? (b) A Trump family member becomes the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) The national polling average from 538 for the 2024 presidential election shows that Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024. This will be confirmed by the value shown on the chart for that specific date when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden.

(b) A member of the Trump family is selected as the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This encompasses Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

para_P.title: Could there be a scenario where either (a) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) A relative of Trump is nominated as the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met:

(a) The national polling average from 538 for the presidential election in 2024 indicates that Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden by more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024. This will be validated by the figure displayed on the chart for that date when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number reflects a lead for Trump, while a negative number shows a lead for Biden.

(b) A Trump family member is chosen as the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

question.title: Will both of the following be true: (1) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents, and (2) Donald Trump Jr. is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
1. There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

2. This question will resolve as YES if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Are both of these statements true: (1) When compared to a generic Democrat, Trump receives a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden, and (2) Donald Trump Jr. does not become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
1. Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to cast their vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks for a vote for a generic Democrat on a similar ballot. This market will resolve to YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll is at least 3% higher than in the second poll when both polls conclude. The calculation for the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the calculation for poll 1 and poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the result is NO.

2. This question will be answered YES if Donald Trump Jr. is not chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. Any other candidates will lead to a NO resolution. This question is not limited to the candidates currently discussed; additional options may emerge later. The outcome is determined solely by the selections made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following conditions will hold: (1) Trump receives at least a 3% advantage among Manifold participants when compared to a generic Democrat, if he faces Joe Biden, and (2) Donald Trump Jr. is not the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
1. Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll solicits votes from Manifold participants for Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other requests votes for a generic Democrat on a similar theoretical ballot. This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more upon closure of both polls. The calculation for Trump's voting percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the calculation for poll 1 and poll 2 is at least 0.03. Otherwise, the result is NO.

2. This inquiry will be answered with YES if Donald Trump Jr. is not chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. Any other candidates will result in a NO. This question is not limited to the candidates currently identified; additional options may emerge later. The determination is solely based on who the delegates of the Republican National Convention select.

2. This question will receive a YES if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** answer. Future candidates may also be considered beyond those currently listed.

The determination of this question is based solely on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), and not on who holds the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. For the purposes of this question, the identity of the individual who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is not relevant; the outcome is solely based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Ted Cruz secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 United States Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This question will be considered **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as their candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** response. There is also the potential for more candidates to emerge in the future.

For the purpose of this inquiry, who ultimately receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is not significant; the determination is based solely on the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any candidate other than Ted Cruz is selected, this will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 3 but not go beyond 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, while Ted Cruz is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(1) This inquiry will conclude as Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure suggests Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate apart from Ted Cruz is chosen, this will also resolve as **Yes**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; other candidates may be included later. The outcome is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) and is not influenced by who the Republican nominee is on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (2) Ted Cruz will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(1) This inquiry will be resolved as Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purpose of this inquiry, a positive figure denotes a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the figure reported for that date shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 in the context of this inquiry.

(2) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any candidate other than Ted Cruz is chosen, this will resolve as **Yes**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; other possibilities may be included in the future. For this question, it does not matter who gets the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is determined solely by who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will both of the following statements hold true: (1) On July 15, 2024, Trump's lead over Biden will exceed 3 but not surpass 4 according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Ted Cruz will not be the nominee for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(1) This question will be answered based on the margin by which Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number signifies a lead for Biden. For example, on July 5, 2024, a reported figure of Trump being 2.4 points ahead of Biden would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

(2) This question will be marked as **Yes** if the Republican National Convention does not select Ted Cruz as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any candidate other than Ted Cruz is picked, the outcome will also be **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the currently discussed candidates; other alternatives may emerge later. The determination of this question does not depend on who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Will Ted Cruz be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 and at most 4 according to 538's national polling average on July 15, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (a) Ted Cruz is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is decided by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden exceeds 3 but does not surpass 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number indicates a lead for Trump.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Ted Cruz will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or that Trump's advantage over Biden will exceed 3 but not surpass 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Ted Cruz is chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. This decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump.

para_P.title: Could Ted Cruz become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or might Trump's lead over Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: This question will receive a **Yes** answer if at least one of the following occurs: (a) Ted Cruz is selected as the Republican National Convention's nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is proclaimed as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when assessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number indicates a Trump advantage.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Resolves YES if no definitive, public, official announcement is made by Joe Biden or his campaign prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. Resolves NO if such a definitive statement is made before this time.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following to happen: (a) a subsequent Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) Joe Biden refraining from announcing before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate involving potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Resolves YES if there is no clear, public, official announcement made by Joe Biden or his campaign before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that Joe Biden will not run for and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election. Resolves NO if such a clear statement is issued before this deadline.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following happen: (a) another debate for the Democratic presidential candidates takes place before the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) Joe Biden does not publicly declare by July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered TRUE if there is a debate involving potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be deemed FALSE otherwise.

(b) This will be deemed TRUE if Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a clear, public, official declaration by 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. It will be considered FALSE if such a clear statement is made prior to this deadline.

para_P.title: Could it be that both of the following occur: (a) a further debate among the Democratic presidential hopefuls happens before the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) Joe Biden does not make a public statement by July 15, 2024, indicating he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be regarded as TRUE if there is a debate featuring potential Democratic candidates (like Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be considered FALSE otherwise.

(b) This will be seen as TRUE if Joe Biden or his campaign fails to deliver a clear, public, official announcement by 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. It will be deemed FALSE if such a clear declaration is made before this deadline.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) there is another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will resolve as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If no such statement is made before the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate? This resolves as Yes if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves as No otherwise.

This question resolves as Yes if either (a) or (b) resolves as Yes.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either (a) Joe Biden declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) another Democratic presidential debate takes place prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden make a declaration before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's presidential nomination? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign publicly and officially announces that he will not seek or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, with no indication that Biden would accept the nomination. If no such announcement is made by the deadline, this will be deemed No.

(b) Will there be an additional presidential debate for the Democratic party? This will be considered Yes if a debate occurs among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be deemed No in other circumstances.

This question will be considered Yes if either (a) or (b) is determined to be Yes.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Joe Biden declares prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) there is an additional Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
para_P.body:
(a) Is Joe Biden going to make a declaration before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be answered with Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement that he will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be clear and definitive, with no possibility of Biden accepting the nomination. If no such announcement is made before the deadline, this will be answered with No.

(b) Is there going to be another presidential debate for the Democratic party? This will be answered with Yes if there is a debate among prospective Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be answered with No in other cases.

This inquiry will be answered with Yes if either (a) or (b) receives a Yes answer.

para_P.title: Could either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) an additional Democratic party presidential debate takes place before the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden make a public announcement prior to July 15, 2024, stating that he will not run for the Democratic Party's presidential nomination? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign releases a clear and official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination for another term as President in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be explicit and final, leaving no room for Biden to accept the nomination. If no such declaration is made by the deadline, the answer will be No.

(b) Is there going to be a further presidential debate for the Democratic party? This will be answered with Yes if a debate occurs among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. The answer will be No in all other scenarios.

This question will be answered affirmatively if either (a) or (b) is answered with Yes.

question.title: Will Google DeepMind publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Google DeepMind will release a report detailing the findings from an independent red-teaming evaluation of their models for safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Google DeepMind, this question will be considered **YES** if they make a *public* report available by June 30, 2024, showcasing the outcomes from an *external* red-teaming assessment of the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Will Google DeepMind release a public report detailing the findings from an outside assessment of their models for safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if they release a *public* report by June 30, 2024, that includes the results from an *external* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Will there be a public disclosure from Google DeepMind regarding the outcomes of an independent evaluation of their safety models prior to June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **YES** if Google DeepMind makes a *public* announcement by June 30, 2024, that presents the findings from an *external* review of the safety of one of their AI systems.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union, and (b) Google DeepMind does not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety?
question.body:
(a) The question about OpenAI's ChatGPT resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(b) For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will both of these events take place: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is accessible to the public in the European Union, and (b) Google DeepMind refrains from releasing a report detailing results from external evaluations of their models regarding safety?
para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry concerning OpenAI's ChatGPT will be deemed **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is publicly accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not. "Publicly accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can utilize it without a VPN (though it may require a payment). If it is not accessible in certain EU nations (as occurred in Italy in early 2023), or not accessible to (for instance) minors, it will still resolve positively, provided that more than 50% of the populace can utilize it. "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(b) Regarding Google DeepMind, this question will resolve as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not release a *public* report containing the results from an *external* organization evaluating the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union, and (b) Google DeepMind refrains from issuing a report detailing results from external safety evaluations of their models?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry regarding OpenAI's ChatGPT will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is broadly accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Broadly accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN (potentially requiring a fee). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (as seen in Italy in early 2023), or not available to certain groups (such as minors), it will still be considered positive, provided that over 50% of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will also be resolved positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries to systems utilizing Large Language Models).

(b) Concerning Google DeepMind, this question will be answered with **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not release a *public* report containing results from an *external* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Will both of the following events occur by June 30, 2024: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is made widely available in the European Union, and (b) Google DeepMind does not publish a report revealing findings from external safety assessments of their models?
para_P.body:
(a) This question about OpenAI's ChatGPT will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" means that the typical situation for people in the EU is that they can access it without needing a VPN (which may involve a fee). If it is not available in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or not accessible to specific demographics (like minors), it will still be deemed affirmative, as long as more than 50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. It will also be considered positive if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally unchanged (inputting queries to systems that utilize Large Language Models).

(b) Regarding Google DeepMind, this inquiry will be answered with **YES** if they do not issue a *public* report that includes results from an *external* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
question.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this part resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this part resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it). If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models, and still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Is it possible that by June 30, 2024, one of the following will happen: (a) a report detailing the results of external safety assessments on Google DeepMind's models is published, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this aspect will be marked as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they release a *public* document with findings from an *independent* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI systems.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this aspect will be marked as **YES** if ChatGPT is broadly accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Broadly accessible" indicates that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without the need for a VPN (which may involve a fee). If it is not available in certain EU nations, or if it is restricted for (for example) minors, it will still be considered positive, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" pertains to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models, and it will still be marked positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries to systems powered by Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that by June 30, 2024, one of the following will happen: (a) Google DeepMind releases a report detailing findings from an external safety evaluation of their models, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) Regarding Google DeepMind, this aspect will be marked as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they issue a *public* report featuring the outcomes from an *independent* assessment of the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) Concerning OpenAI's ChatGPT, this aspect will be marked as **YES** if ChatGPT is broadly accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Broadly accessible" indicates that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (potentially requiring a fee). If it is not available in certain EU nations, or not available to (for instance) minors, this will still be considered positive, provided that over 50% of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" pertains to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models, and still counts positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries to systems powered by Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Is there a chance that by June 30, 2024, one of the following scenarios will occur: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report outlining results from an external safety review of their models, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes generally available in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this will be marked as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they release a *public* report that includes the findings from an *independent* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) Regarding OpenAI's ChatGPT, this will be marked as **YES** if ChatGPT is widely available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Widely available" means that the typical situation for individuals in the EU is that they can access it without utilizing a VPN (possibly requiring a fee). If it is not accessible in certain EU countries, or not available to (for example) minors, this will still count positively, as long as more than 50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models, and it still counts positively if the name or website changes, provided that OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries to systems powered by Large Language Models).
