question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but at most 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be settled based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the figure recorded for that date shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but no more than 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, whereas a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would translate to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden exceed 2 but remain under 3 according to the national polling average from 538 on July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be deemed resolved based on the degree of Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as presented in the chart for July 15, 2024, when evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number reflects a Trump lead, while a negative number indicates a Biden advantage. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, and (2) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(1) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must be on camera, and can include appearances on a podcast, late night show, or a show like 60 minutes, but there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not count. If no qualifying interview is released before the end of July, this condition is not met. 

(2) Trump's lead over Biden must be either less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates Biden is leading. The value will be checked on the chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

Both conditions must be satisfied for the overall question to resolve YES.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (1) Joe Biden conduct an in-person interview on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024, and (2) Trump's advantage over Biden be either 2 or less, or exceed 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden is required to take part in an in-person interview for no less than 45 minutes prior to the end of July 2024. This interview must be filmed and can feature appearances on platforms such as podcasts, late-night shows, or programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage showing Biden being interviewed in person. Events like press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not qualify. If no acceptable interview is released before the end of July, this condition is not fulfilled. 

(2) Trump's lead over Biden must be either 2 or fewer, or more than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538 for the 2024 presidential election. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. The figure will be verified on the chart for July 15, 2024, which will be accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

Both criteria must be met for the overall question to be answered with YES.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (1) Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview recorded for over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024, and (2) Trump's advantage over Biden be at most 2 or exceed 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden is required to engage in a face-to-face interview lasting no less than 45 minutes prior to the end of July 2024. This interview must be recorded and can feature appearances on platforms such as podcasts, late night shows, or programs like 60 Minutes, but it must include at least 45 minutes of fresh footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Events such as press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not qualify. If no suitable interview is published before the end of July, this requirement is unmet. 

(2) Trump's margin over Biden must be either equal to or less than 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. The value will be verified on the chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

Both criteria must be fulfilled for the overall inquiry to be answered with YES.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will occur: (1) Joe Biden will take part in a recorded in-person interview lasting more than 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, and (2) Trump's lead over Biden will either be a maximum of 2 or exceed 3 on July 15, 2024, as per 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden must participate in a recorded face-to-face interview lasting at least 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024. This interview should be recorded and may appear on platforms like podcasts, late-night talk shows, or programs such as 60 Minutes, but it must contain at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in person. Events like press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not qualify. If a suitable interview is not published before the end of July, then this requirement is not met. 

(2) Trump's lead over Biden must be either at most 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. A positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number suggests Biden is ahead. The value will be confirmed on the chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

Both conditions must be satisfied for the overall question to receive a YES answer.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) On July 15, 2024, Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but is at most 3 according to 538's national polling average? (b) Before the end of July 2024, Joe Biden engages in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies a Biden lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported figure for that date shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

(b) The latest qualifying interview took place when Biden appeared on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

Should Biden participate in another such in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes, this market will conclude with a YES. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, this market will conclude with a NO. 

This market does not account for press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews edited into programs like 60 Minutes. However, there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of fresh footage showing Biden being interviewed in person for such appearances to qualify. A 50-minute video might feature only 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, thus not qualifying.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his guest spot on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 Minutes each contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a compilation of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following will take place: (a) Trump's margin over Biden exceeds 2 but is at most 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average? (b) Joe Biden engages in a 45-minute or longer in-person interview or discussion on camera before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) The outcome of this question will be determined by Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative number indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value showed Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

(b) The latest qualifying interview occurred during Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes.

If Biden participates in another qualifying in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes, this market will resolve to YES. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve to NO.

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. However, it can include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews that are edited into programs like 60 Minutes, as long as there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in-person. For example, a 50-minute video might only show 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify.

For additional context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes have each contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

para_P.title: Could one of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden surpasses 2 but does not exceed 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Joe Biden participates in an in-person interview or discussion on camera lasting 45 minutes or more before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) The resolution of this question will be based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive value indicates Trump is ahead, while a negative value signifies Biden is in the lead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure indicated Trump was leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

(b) The most recent qualifying interview took place during Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he answered questions for about 70 minutes.

If Biden takes part in another qualifying in-person interview that lasts at least 45 minutes, this market will resolve to YES. On the other hand, if no qualifying interview is made public prior to the market's closure at the end of July, it will resolve to NO.

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. However, it can include guest spots on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews that are edited into programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in-person. For instance, a 50-minute video might only display 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify.

For further context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes have all contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

question.title: Will the Orlando Magic win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Orlando Magic are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Are the Orlando Magic going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Orlando Magic are awarded the title of champions in the 2024 NBA Finals, based on information from [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be answered with **No** for any other teams as they will not be in the running.

para_P.title: Are the Orlando Magic going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Orlando Magic secure victory in the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be answered with **No** for all other teams that do not win.

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals and the Orlando Magic not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/): (a) The New York Knicks are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals. (b) The Orlando Magic are not crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals. It resolves as **No** if either the New York Knicks do not win the Finals or the Orlando Magic win the Finals.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will any of the specified Israeli leaders have arrest warrants issued by the International Criminal Court prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below before July 1, 2024. It will be deemed **No** in all other cases.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will any of the specified Israeli leaders face arrest warrants from the International Criminal Court prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below before July 1, 2024. It will be marked as **No** in the absence of such warrants.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Are there any chances that any of the designated Israeli officials will receive arrest warrants from the International Criminal Court before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) releases a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli leaders listed below ahead of July 1, 2024. It will receive a **No** if no such warrants are issued.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics (2) Before July 1, 2024, the ICC does not issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
(1) The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following two events will take place: (1) A terrorist incident happens in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics (2) The ICC refrains from issuing arrest warrants for any of the specified Israeli leaders prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) This question will be answered with Yes if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) causes injury or death to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The answer will be No if this does not occur.

An event will qualify as a 'terrorist incident' if it is categorized as such by any French State agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(2) The question will be considered **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue an [arrest warrant](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the following Israeli cabinet officials before July 1, 2024. It will be deemed **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) A terrorist incident takes place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics (2) Prior to July 1, 2024, the ICC does not release arrest warrants for any of the specified Israeli leaders?
para_P.body:
(1) The question will be answered as Yes if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) causes injury and/or death to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), from the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The response will be No if this does not occur.

An event will qualify as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any governmental agency of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(2) This question will be answered as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) refrains from issuing a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the listed Israeli cabinet members. It will be answered as **No** if that does not happen.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) A terrorist event happens in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics (2) Before July 1, 2024, the ICC does not issue arrest warrants for any of the mentioned Israeli leaders?
para_P.body:
(1) This question will be marked as Yes if a terrorist event in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in harm and/or fatalities to at least one person, excluding the terrorist(s), from the date of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the date of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The answer will be No if this does not take place.

An occurrence will be considered a 'terrorist event' if it is designated as such by any governmental body of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(2) This question will be marked as **Yes** if, prior to July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not release a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the aforementioned Israeli cabinet officials. It will be marked as **No** if that does not happen.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) the ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders by July 1, 2024, (b) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

(b) The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following takes place: (a) the ICC issues arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials by July 1, 2024, (b) a terrorist incident occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if prior to July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) releases a warrant for the arrest of any of these Israeli government figures: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). It will be answered with **No** otherwise.

(b) The inquiry will be answered with Yes if a terrorist incident in Metropolitan France results in injuries and/or fatalities of at least one person, excluding the terrorist(s), from the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). It will be answered with No if this does not occur. An event will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any agency of the French State, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following takes place: (a) the ICC issues arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials by July 1, 2024, or (b) a terrorist incident occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if, prior to July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues an arrest warrant for any of these Israeli government figures: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). It will be marked as **No** if this does not occur.

(b) The inquiry will be considered Yes if a terrorist incident in Metropolitan France results in injury and/or death of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). It will be marked as No if this does not happen. An incident will be classified as a 'terrorist act' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Could one of the following occur: (a) the ICC issues arrest warrants for certain Israeli officials by July 1, 2024, or (b) a terrorist act takes place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be marked as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues an arrest warrant for any of the following Israeli leaders: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). It will be marked as **No** if this does not happen.

(b) The question will be considered Yes if a terrorist act in Metropolitan France results in injury and/or death of at least one person, not including the terrorist(s), from the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). It will be marked as No if this does not occur. An incident will be deemed a 'terrorist act' if it is classified as such by any French State authority, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4, based on the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference between Donald Trump and Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates Trump is leading, while a negative figure implies Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 3 but less than 4, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved by the degree of Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden as reflected by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the date of July 15, 2024, when assessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number represents a lead for Trump, whereas a negative number indicates that Biden is ahead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

For condition (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For condition (b), a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden. The question will resolve as **Yes** if Trump's lead is <= 3 or > 4 on the specified date.

para_P.title: Is Chris Christie going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and will Trump's advantage over Biden be 3 points or less, or exceed 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is 3 points or less or exceeds 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the chart viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

For criterion (a), it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on election day in 2024; it is determined solely by the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For criterion (b), a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, a figure of 2.4 indicates Trump is leading Biden by 2.4 points. The inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Trump's lead is <= 3 or > 4 on the specified date.

para_P.title: Is Chris Christie going to be the GOP candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and will Trump's advantage over Biden be at most 3 or exceed 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is at most 3 or exceeds 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the data accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

For criterion (a), it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For criterion (b), a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, a figure of 2.4 means Trump has a 2.4-point lead over Biden. The inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Trump's lead is <= 3 or > 4 on the specified date.

para_P.title: Will Chris Christie be the nominee for the GOP in the 2024 US Presidential Election, and will Trump's lead over Biden be at most 3 or more than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a response of **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is at most 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, based on the information retrieved by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

Regarding condition (a), it is irrelevant who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Concerning condition (b), a positive number signifies a Trump advantage, while a negative number indicates Biden is in the lead. For example, a number of 2.4 means Trump leads Biden by 2.4 points. The answer will be **Yes** if Trump's lead is <= 3 or > 4 on the specified date.

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. (b) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 and at most 4 in 538's national polling average, or will Chris Christie be the GOP candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) exceeds 3 and is at most 4 on July 15, 2024, as indicated on the chart when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. (b) Chris Christie is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based solely on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4 according to 538's national polling average, or will Chris Christie be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is more than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on the chart viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. Here, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. (b) Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based purely on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 3 but less than or equal to 4 in 538's national polling average on July 15, 2024, or will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) exceeds 3 but does not go beyond 4, as per the chart reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number signifies Trump's lead, while a negative number indicates that Biden is in front. (b) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination relies solely on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on who is declared as the nominee on the election day in 2024.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if they fail to qualify, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they fail to advance, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur in Eurovision 2024: (a) Slovenia qualifies for the Grand Final, and (b) Malta fails to qualify for the Grand Final?

If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that in Eurovision 2024, both Slovenia will make it to the Grand Final and Malta will not?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if the following two criteria are satisfied: (a) Slovenia competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Malta either does not compete in a Semi-final or is not confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either of these criteria is not fulfilled, the inquiry will be considered **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that in Eurovision 2024, Slovenia will make it to the Grand Final while Malta will not?
para_P.body: This question will be considered **Yes** if the following two criteria are fulfilled: (a) Slovenia takes part in a Semi-final and is declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) to have qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Malta either does not compete in a Semi-final or is not declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) to have qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either of these criteria is not satisfied, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will Slovenia reach the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 while Malta fails to do so?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Malta either does not take part in a Semi-final or is not recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either of these conditions is not fulfilled, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Malta or Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Malta or Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Malta or Slovenia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either Malta or Slovenia competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial and (b) Will Hurd is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: 

1. [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

2. Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this condition is met. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: 

1. [Reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) confirm that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) regarding the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

2. Will Hurd is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any different candidate is chosen, this condition is fulfilled. This is solely based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden be projected as the favorite by FiveThirtyEight on July 19, 2024, and (b) Tim Scott not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden is projected to have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. This is determined by the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast page for that date. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this condition is not met. The resolution will occur as soon as the July 20 datapoints become available, or by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, using the nearest previous figures to July 19 if necessary.

(b) Tim Scott is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this condition is met. The resolution is based solely on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will either Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will 538 project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

1. A positive value means a Trump lead.

2. Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

2. Tucker Carlson is not nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but at most 3 based on 538's national polling average?

In this scenario, a positive number indicates Trump's lead, while a negative number indicates Biden is in front. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Greens–EFA holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) Trump's lead over Biden is ≤ 2 or > 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, this sub-question will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) the Greens–EFA group secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) Trump's advantage over Biden is ≤ 2 or > 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and it will be answered with **No** for all other scenarios. In the event of a tie between two groups for the highest number of seats, this sub-question will be answered with **Yes**. The resolution of this question is based on [official statements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

(b) This question will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates a Biden lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value for that date shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) the Greens–EFA will secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) Trump's advantage over Biden is ≤ 2 or > 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and will be marked as **No** for all other results. If two parties are equal in the number of seats, this sub-question will also be marked as **Yes**. The resolution of this question is based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

(b) This question will be considered **Yes** if Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is either less than or equal to 2 or exceeds 3 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, as reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value of 2.4 indicates Trump is ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be classified as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

para_P.title: Will both of the following events occur: (a) the Greens–EFA will achieve the highest seat count after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) Trump's lead over Biden is either ≤ 2 or > 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will receive a **Yes** if the Greens–EFA party attains the most seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections, and will be marked as **No** for all other outcomes. If two parties have an equal number of seats, this sub-question will also be marked as **Yes**. The answer to this question is determined by [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media outlets.

(b) This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is either less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on the specified date of July 15, 2024, as evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive number indicates Trump is ahead, while a negative number shows Biden is leading. For example, on July 5, 2024, a reported value of 2.4 signifies Trump is leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be recorded as a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

For instance, if the report on July 5, 2024, indicates Trump is ahead by 2.4 points, this would count as a positive 2.4 for this question.

(b) This question will be marked as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA group has the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and it will be marked as **No** for any other results. In the case of a tie between two groups for the number of seats, both sub-questions will be marked as **Yes**. The resolution of this question will rely on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media sources.

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently being discussed; additional options may be introduced later.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 and (b) Francis Suarez is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) The Democrats will have a brokered convention in 2024 if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this condition is not met.

(b) Francis Suarez will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This condition is met if any other candidate is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following situations will take place: (a) The Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024 and (b) Francis Suarez does not become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) A brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024 will occur if the Democratic Party needs to hold more than one round of voting during its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, then this situation does not apply.

(b) Francis Suarez will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This situation is satisfied if any other candidate is picked by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) The Democrats will experience a brokered convention in 2024 and (b) Francis Suarez will not be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) A brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024 will happen if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting during its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot suffices, then this condition does not apply.

(b) Francis Suarez will not serve as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This condition holds true if any other candidate is picked by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Will both of the following scenarios occur: (a) The Democrats face a brokered convention in 2024 and (b) Francis Suarez will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) A brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024 will occur if the Democratic Party requires multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is needed, then this situation does not apply.

(b) Francis Suarez will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the candidate. This condition is satisfied if any other individual is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, resulting in a brokered convention. If neither of these events occurs, the question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Francis Suarez becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that the Democrats face a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Francis Suarez is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, as decided by the delegates of the Republican National Convention rather than the nomination announced on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) The Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, leading to a brokered convention. If neither of these scenarios happens, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) Francis Suarez becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) The Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Francis Suarez is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is based on the decision made by the delegates, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on election day in 2024. (b) The Democratic Party needs to conduct multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, leading to a brokered convention. If neither scenario occurs, the response will be **No**.

para_P.title: Could it be that one of the following occurs: (a) Francis Suarez is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) The Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This question will receive a **Yes** if at least one of the following events happens: (a) The delegates of the Republican National Convention choose Francis Suarez as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This choice is determined by the delegates' decision, not by who is declared the Republican nominee on election day in 2024. (b) The Democratic Party finds it necessary to have several rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, resulting in a brokered convention. If neither of these situations takes place, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.
