para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the following criteria is fulfilled: (1) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) surpasses 3 and is at most 4 points on July 15, 2024, as indicated on the chart for that date, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure shows a lead for Trump. (2) Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This conclusion is based on the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than who is named the nominee on election day.

para_P.title: By July 15, 2024, will the lead that Trump holds over Biden be greater than 3 but less than or equal to 4 according to the national polling average from 538, or will Larry Elder be selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (1) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is more than 3 and at most 4 points, as shown in the chart for that date, which will be verified by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a lead for Trump. (2) Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than who is announced as the nominee on election day.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they claim suppresses the critical ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, represents the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members remain profoundly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and I guess through sheer force, achieve consensus, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public statement against the early nomination proposal is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to express their opposition to their party’s move to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination earlier than planned, which they believe suppresses the critical ongoing discussions regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that was drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, serves as the first public indication from Democrats following the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members are significantly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market will settle as YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who identify with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures combined would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will settle as NO.

para_P.title: Will at least 20 Democratic lawmakers from either the House or Senate publicly oppose the initiative to expedite Biden's nomination?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Several House Democrats are organizing a plan to voice their disapproval of their party's effort to finalize President Joe Biden's nomination sooner than originally scheduled, which they argue undermines the essential ongoing conversations about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A letter that was prepared, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, represents the first public signal from Democrats following the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members are deeply worried about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and I suppose through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He opted not to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market will conclude as YES if a public declaration against the early nomination initiative is endorsed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements combined would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market will conclude as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) Fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This question resolves as Yes if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as No.

(b) Fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Democrats will hold a brokered convention in 2024 (b) Less than 20 House/Senate Democrats will endorse a public letter against the proposal to virtually nominate Biden ahead of time?
para_P.body:
(a) Democrats will hold a brokered convention in 2024: This question is answered with a Yes if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, then this question is answered with a No.

(b) Less than 20 House/Senate Democrats will endorse a public letter against the early nomination plan: This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who are affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Several such letters combined with fewer than 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice for this market to resolve to YES. If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of these events will happen: (a) Democrats will hold a brokered convention in 2024 (b) Less than 20 Democratic House/Senate members will publicly oppose the plan to nominate Biden virtually ahead of time?
para_P.body:
(a) Democrats will hold a brokered convention in 2024: This question is answered with Yes if the Democratic Party needs more than one voting round in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If just one vote is needed, then the answer will be No.

(b) Less than 20 Democratic House/Senate members publicly sign a letter against the plan to nominate Biden virtually early: This market will resolve YES if a public letter against the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 members of the House or Senate who are part of the Democratic Party before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. Additionally, if there are multiple letters with a total of fewer than 20 lawmakers' signatures, this will also lead to a YES resolution for this market. If these conditions are not satisfied by the market close, the resolution will be NO.

para_P.title: Will both of the following scenarios occur: (a) The Democrats will convene a brokered convention in 2024 (b) Fewer than 20 Democratic members of the House/Senate will publicly oppose the initiative to virtually nominate Biden beforehand?
para_P.body:
(a) The Democrats will convene a brokered convention in 2024: This question is answered affirmatively if the Democratic Party requires more than one voting round in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single vote is necessary, the answer will be negative.

(b) Fewer than 20 Democratic members of the House/Senate publicly endorse a letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden in advance: This market will resolve affirmatively if a public letter against the early nomination plan is endorsed by fewer than 20 members of the House or Senate who belong to the Democratic Party before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. Furthermore, if there are several letters with a cumulative total of fewer than 20 lawmakers' signatures, this will also result in an affirmative resolution for this market. If these criteria are not met by the market close, the resolution will be negative.

question.title: Will either at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, or will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following conditions are met: (a) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient. (b) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If neither condition is met, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate publicly oppose the plan to nominate Biden early, or will there be a contested convention for Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) At least 20 lawmakers from the Democratic Party's House or Senate sign a public letter against the early nomination plan before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st, 2024. It is also acceptable if multiple letters collectively have 20 signatures from lawmakers. (b) The Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If neither scenario occurs, the question will be deemed **No**.

para_P.title: Will at least 20 Democrats from the House or Senate publicly express opposition to the plan for Biden's early nomination, or will there be a brokered convention for Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either of the following scenarios occurs: (a) A public statement against the early nomination plan is endorsed by a minimum of 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st, 2024. It is also acceptable if multiple letters collectively bear the signatures of 20 lawmakers. (b) The Democratic Party necessitates more than one voting round during its roll call to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If neither scenario takes place, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from either the House or Senate make a public statement opposing the proposal for Biden's early nomination, or will the Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This question will receive a response of **Yes** if one of the following conditions is met: (a) At least 20 Democratic House or Senate members publicly denounce the early nomination plan before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st, 2024. It is also acceptable if several letters are signed by a total of 20 lawmakers. (b) The Democratic Party requires more than one voting round during its roll call to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If neither of these conditions occurs, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the advantage of Trump over Biden be more than 2 but at most 3 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the recorded value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: By July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3, based on the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump’s lead over Biden be greater than 2 but less than 3, according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This question will be determined by how much Donald Trump is leading Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number reflects Trump’s lead, while a negative number indicates Biden is ahead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump is 2.4 points in front of Biden, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) Tim Scott being the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Trump's advantage over Biden being 2 or less or more than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be marked as **Yes** if Tim Scott is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced in the future.

For this question, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) This question will be determined by the measure of Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the figure reported for July 5 shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) Tim Scott becoming the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Trump's advantage over Biden being no more than 2 or exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Tim Scott is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** outcome. This question is not limited to the candidates currently identified; additional options may be included later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) This inquiry will settle based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as recorded on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies a Biden lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value for that date shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be represented as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: Can both of the following scenarios occur: (a) Tim Scott being selected as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Trump's lead over Biden being at most 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be answered with **Yes** if Tim Scott is named by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidates are chosen, the outcome will be **No**. This question does not only pertain to the candidates currently recognized; further candidates may be added later.

For this question, the identity of the Republican nominee on the date of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is solely based on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) The answer to this question will depend on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as noted on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number indicates a Trump lead, while a negative number indicates a Biden lead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported value for that date shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be represented as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is more than 2 and at most 3 points on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead.

(b) This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if Tim Scott is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following scenarios will happen: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but does not go beyond 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, or (b) Tim Scott becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be answered as Yes if the national polling average from 538 for the 2024 presidential election shows that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is more than 2 and at most 3 points on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive score indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative score signifies that Biden is ahead.

(b) This question will be answered as Yes if Tim Scott is chosen as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. This decision is based solely on the delegates' selection at the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Could either of the following situations occur: (a) On July 15, 2024, Trump's lead over Biden surpasses 2 but does not exceed 3 according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Tim Scott is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will receive a Yes response if the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election indicates that Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 and at most 3 points on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive score reflects a lead for Trump, while a negative score indicates Biden is in front.

(b) This question will be answered affirmatively if Tim Scott is nominated as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. This determination relies solely on the choices made by the delegates at the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Kamala's chances of winning will rise in the upcoming week based on Nate Silver's model?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris, according to Nate Silver's model, exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will be deemed NO in all other cases.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Are Kamala's chances of victory expected to rise in the upcoming week based on Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Electoral College likelihood for Harris in Nate Silver's analysis surpasses 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will be deemed NO in all other cases.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Is it anticipated that Kamala's probability of winning will increase in the next week according to Nate Silver's evaluation?
para_P.body:
A YES will be determined if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's evaluation exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. Any other situation will be classified as NO.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (b) Kamala's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

(b) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Kamala's chances of winning remain unchanged over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive announcement is not made by 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

(b) Resolves YES if the probability of Harris in the Electoral College according to Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Joe Biden will make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (b) Kamala Harris's chances of winning will not improve in the upcoming week as per Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official public statement declaring that he will not pursue nor accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

To achieve a **Yes** outcome, the declaration must be unequivocal and definitive: it must eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, the outcome will be **No**.

(b) The resolution is YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM; otherwise, it is NO.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden will publicly state before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (b) according to Nate Silver's analysis, Kamala Harris's chances of winning will not improve in the next week?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will receive a **Yes** if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign provides a clear and official public announcement indicating that he will not seek or accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** response, the statement must be clear and conclusive: it must rule out any chance that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election.

If such a definitive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, the response will be **No**.

(b) The result is YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM; otherwise, it is NO.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Will a Woman be the Democratic Candidate for President in 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be affirmed with a "yes" when the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidency in the 2024 election.

It will be affirmed with a "no" when the Democratic delegates choose a male candidate for the presidency in the 2024 election.

para_P.body:
This will conclude with a “yes” if the Democratic delegates choose a woman as their presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

This will conclude with a “no” if the Democratic delegates choose a man as their presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Will a Woman be the Democratic Party's Candidate for President in 2024?
para_P.body:
This will result in a “yes” if a woman is selected by the Democratic delegates as their candidate for the presidential election in 2024.

This will result in a “no” if a man is selected by the Democratic delegates as their candidate for the presidential election in 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics (b) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is a Man?
question.body:
(a) The question about the 2024 Olympics resolves as Yes if any National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in at least two of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, it resolves as No. 

(b) The question about the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee resolves as Yes if the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election. It resolves as No if they select a female presidential nominee.

This combined question resolves as Yes only if both (a) and (b) resolve as Yes.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) A single country secures victories in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics (b) The Democratic Party's presidential candidate in 2024 is male?
para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry regarding the 2024 Olympics is answered affirmatively if any National Olympic Committee (NOC) achieves gold in at least two of the eight women's team sports: soccer, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. If not, the answer is negative. 

(b) The question concerning the Democratic Party's presidential nominee for 2024 is answered affirmatively if the Democratic delegates choose a male candidate for the presidency. If they opt for a female candidate, the answer is negative.

This combined inquiry receives an affirmative answer only if both (a) and (b) are answered affirmatively.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) A single country secures victories in more than one women's team event at the 2024 Olympics (b) The Democratic Party's nominee for President in 2024 is a male?
para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry regarding the 2024 Olympics is answered with Yes if any National Olympic Committee (NOC) achieves gold in at least two out of the eight women's team sports: soccer, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. If not, the answer is No. 

(b) The question concerning the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is answered with Yes if the Democratic delegates choose a male candidate for the presidential election in 2024. It is answered with No if they select a female candidate.

This combined query is answered with Yes only if both (a) and (b) are answered with Yes.

para_P.title: Will it be the case that both of the following occur: (a) One nation achieves triumphs in multiple women's team competitions at the 2024 Olympics (b) The Democratic Party's candidate for President in 2024 is male?
para_P.body:
(a) The question about the 2024 Olympics receives a Yes if any National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in at least two of the eight women's team sports: soccer, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. If this does not happen, the answer is No. 

(b) The inquiry regarding the Democratic Presidential Nominee for 2024 is answered with Yes if the Democratic delegates select a male candidate for the presidential election in 2024. It is No if a female candidate is chosen.

This overall question is affirmed with Yes only if both (a) and (b) receive a Yes response.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman? (b) The same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
(a) The question about the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee resolves “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. It resolves “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

(b) The question about the 2024 Olympics resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, it resolves as Yes if the same NOC wins at least two of these events.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either: (a) A Woman becomes the Democratic Presidential Nominee in 2024? (b) A single country secures victories in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry regarding the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee will be considered 'yes' if the Democratic delegates choose a woman as their presidential nominee for the upcoming election. It will be deemed 'no' if a man is selected as the nominee by the Democratic delegates.

(b) The question concerning the 2024 Olympics will be answered 'no' if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) each win gold in the eight team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Conversely, it will be answered 'yes' if one NOC wins gold in at least two of these competitions.

para_P.title: Is it possible that: (a) A Woman will be the Democratic Presidential Nominee in 2024? (b) A single country secures victories in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry regarding the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is considered “yes” if the Democratic delegates choose a woman as their presidential nominee for the upcoming election. It is deemed “no” if the nominee selected is a man.

(b) The question concerning the 2024 Olympics will be answered with No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) claim gold medals in the eight team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Conversely, it will be answered with Yes if one NOC wins gold in at least two of these disciplines.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that: (a) A female candidate becomes the Democratic Presidential Nominee in 2024? (b) A single nation achieves triumphs in several women's team sports during the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) The question about the Democratic Presidential Nominee for 2024 is answered with “yes” if a woman is selected by the Democratic delegates as their nominee for the presidential race. It is answered with “no” if a male is chosen as the nominee.

(b) The inquiry about the 2024 Olympics will receive a No if teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold medals in the eight team sports: soccer, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Conversely, it will receive a Yes if one NOC secures gold in at least two of these events.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Biden will be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's own invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Could Biden be considered unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
This will be marked as a YES if the Vice President, alongside a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and duties of his office" and permits the Vice President to assume the role of President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not affect this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidential role due to death, resignation, etc., is not part of this consideration. Biden's own use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not relevant.

Context: A Republican legislator urges Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President AND (2) Biden is not declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

(2) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (1) Joe Biden makes a statement before July 15, 2024 indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President AND (2) Biden is not deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official declaration stating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

(2) It resolves to YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other applicable body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and do not enable the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of any incapacity is irrelevant. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not considered.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) Joe Biden makes a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, AND (2) Biden is not officially declared incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unequivocal and final, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

(2) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially assert that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and do not enable the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of any incapacity is irrelevant. Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

para_P.title: Will both of the following events occur: (1) Joe Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, AND (2) Biden is not officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement stating that he will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be clear and final, with no chance that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

(2) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) do not activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and do not empower the Vice President to assume the role of President before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of any incapacity is not relevant. Biden's exit from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) Biden is declared unfit under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, (b) Joe Biden publicly states before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will resolve to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden utilizing section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not considered.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election. For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that one of the following happens: (a) Biden is declared unable to perform his duties under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, (b) Joe Biden publicly states before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

(b) This question will be answered with Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. For a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following occurs: (a) Biden is determined to be incapable of executing his responsibilities under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024, (b) Joe Biden announces publicly before July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be deemed YES if the Vice President, together with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent authority), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to carry out the powers and duties of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity is not relevant for this question. Biden's exit from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not considered.

(b) This question will receive a Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official declaration indicating that Joe Biden will not seek or accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. For a Yes outcome, the statement must be unequivocal and definitive: it should remove any doubt that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

This will be answered with YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate authority), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to carry out the powers and duties of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday, July 19, 2024, and (b) Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. It resolves to “No” if Trump has a higher probability. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, it resolves 50-50. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, it resolves according to the nearest previous figures.

(b) This question resolves to YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare Biden unable to discharge his duties before August 2024. Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., does not count, nor does Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment. The duration of incapacity does not matter.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) on Friday, July 19, 2024, the 538 Project will show Biden as the frontrunner, and (b) Biden will not be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) The resolution of this question is “Yes” if the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024, indicates that Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump. It will be “No” if Trump is shown to have a better chance. If their probabilities are equal, it will resolve to 50-50. The source for this resolution is FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election. If data for July 19 is not available by July 22, it will resolve based on the closest preceding data.

(b) This question will be answered YES if neither the Vice President nor a majority of the Cabinet invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare Biden unable to fulfill his responsibilities before August 2024. Situations such as Biden leaving office due to death or resignation do not count, nor does Biden's own invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment. The length of incapacity is irrelevant.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) FiveThirtyEight forecasts Biden as the frontrunner on Friday, July 19, 2024, and (b) Biden remains unrecognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This question is answered with “Yes” if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election prediction for July 19, 2024. It is answered with “No” if Trump is forecasted to have a better chance. If Biden and Trump are shown to have equal probabilities, it resolves to 50-50. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election. If there is no data available for July 19 by July 22, the resolution will be based on the closest preceding figures.

(b) This question will be answered with YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare Biden incapable of fulfilling his responsibilities before August 2024. Biden's departure from office due to death, resignation, etc., is not included, nor is Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment. The length of incapacity is irrelevant.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following events will occur: (a) FiveThirtyEight predicts Biden as the leading candidate on Friday, July 19, 2024, and (b) Biden is not deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry receives a “Yes” if FiveThirtyEight's election forecast for July 19, 2024, indicates that Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump. It is marked “No” if Trump is shown to have a superior chance. If both candidates are indicated to have equal chances, the outcome will be 50-50. The source for resolution is FiveThirtyEight's prediction for the 2024 presidential election. Should there be no data available for July 19 by July 22, the decision will rely on the nearest prior data.

(b) This question will be marked YES if Section 4 of the 25th Amendment is not invoked by the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet to declare Biden unable to perform his duties before August 2024. Exclusions include Biden's exit from office due to death, resignation, etc., and Biden's own invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment. The duration of incapacity is not a factor.

question.title: Will either Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, or will 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This occurs if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. (b) FiveThirtyEight projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024. This occurs if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either Biden will be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024, or that 538 will indicate Biden as the leading candidate on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if one of the following takes place: (a) Biden is officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024. This situation arises if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as the President before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not considered. (b) FiveThirtyEight indicates Biden as the leading candidate on July 19, 2024. This occurs if Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump are shown to have equal probabilities, this market will resolve with a 50-50 outcome. The resolution will be based on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the data represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any changes in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to compute its figures will not affect the resolution of this market. The market will resolve based on the data points for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 becomes available. If there are no data points for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest previous figures to July 19.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either Biden will be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024, or that 538 will indicate Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not considered. (b) FiveThirtyEight designates Biden as the leading candidate on July 19, 2024. This means that Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump are equally likely, this market will resolve at 50-50. The resolution will be based on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines for the date of resolution. Any changes in the way FiveThirtyEight calculates its data will not affect the outcome of this market. This market will conclude based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 is available. If there are no data points for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the closest prior figures to July 19.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Biden could be considered incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024, or that FiveThirtyEight will show Biden as the leading candidate on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will receive a YES response if one of the following conditions occurs: (a) Biden is acknowledged as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024. This would occur if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent group) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to execute the powers and responsibilities of his office" and permit the Vice President to assume presidential duties, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity is not relevant to this question. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded. (b) FiveThirtyEight identifies Biden as the primary candidate on July 19, 2024. The resolution will rely on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines for the date of resolution. Any alterations in the method FiveThirtyEight uses to calculate its data will not influence the outcome of this market. This market will conclude based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 is accessible. If there are no data points for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest prior figures to July 19.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat (b) No member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(b) Resolves **Yes** if none of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Trump receives a minimum of 3% more support among Manifold participants when compared to Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat (b) No member of the Trump family will be the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to cast their votes for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks for votes for a generic Democrat on a hypothetical ballot.

Surveys of public opinion generally indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, yet all other Democrats surveyed in similar hypothetical scenarios are either leading or within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or greater at the time both polls close.

The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

(b) Resolves as **Yes** if none of the following individuals becomes the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Trump achieves a minimum of 3% increase among Manifold respondents when compared to Joe Biden rather than a standard Democrat (b) No Trump family member secures the Republican nomination for the US Presidency in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks for their choice with a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the result is NO.

(b) Resolves **Yes** if none of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
