question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden remain in office as president until the end of July?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still the officially recognized president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is Joe Biden going to remain in the presidency until the conclusion of July?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a yes if, at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden is still the officially recognized president of the United States.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden stay in the presidency until the end of July?
para_P.body: This market will be resolved with a yes if, at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden continues to be the officially acknowledged president of the United States.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early; (b) Joe Biden is not president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats must sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early. This involves a drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman, opposing the Democratic Party's effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned. The letter must be signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 signatures are also sufficient.

(b) Joe Biden must not be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. If he is not president at that time, this condition is met.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) A minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate will endorse a public letter against the plan to nominate Biden early; (b) Joe Biden will not hold the presidency by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) A minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate need to endorse a public letter that opposes the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule. This letter, drafted and circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman, is against the Democratic Party's strategy to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended. The letter must receive endorsements from at least 20 House Members or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party before the deadline of Sunday, July 21st. Additionally, multiple letters that collectively gather 20 signatures will also fulfill this requirement.

(b) Joe Biden must not be the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. If he is not serving as president at that specific time, this condition will be satisfied.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) A minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the plan to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule; (b) Joe Biden is not holding the presidency by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) A minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate need to endorse a public letter that opposes the initiative to virtually nominate Biden sooner than initially intended. This pertains to a letter drafted and circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman, contesting the Democratic Party's attempt to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination. The letter must receive endorsements from at least 20 members of the House or Senate who align with the Democratic Party prior to the end of Sunday, July 21st. Several letters that collectively gather 20 signatures will also satisfy this requirement.

(b) Joe Biden must not be the officially recognized president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. If he is not in office at that specified time, this condition will be fulfilled.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will occur: (a) At least 20 Democratic members in the House or Senate publicly support a letter opposing the plan to prematurely nominate Biden; (b) Joe Biden will not be serving as president by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) At least 20 Democratic representatives in either the House or Senate must publicly support a letter that challenges the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of the original schedule. This refers to a letter created and shared by Rep. Jared Huffman, which opposes the Democratic Party's effort to hasten President Joe Biden’s nomination. The letter needs to gain public support from no fewer than 20 Democratic members of Congress before the deadline of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters that together collect 20 endorsements will also meet this criterion.

(b) Joe Biden must not hold the position of president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. If he is out of office by that exact time, this requirement will be satisfied.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024, or at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024; (b) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures are sufficient for a YES resolution. If neither condition is met, the answer is NO.

para_P.title: By the conclusion of July 2024, will Joe Biden remain in office as president, or will a minimum of 20 Democratic House or Senate members endorse a public letter against the early nomination proposal?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if one of the following scenarios takes place: (a) Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024; (b) A public letter opposing the early nomination proposal is endorsed by no fewer than 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes on Sunday, July 21, 2024. It is acceptable for multiple letters to collectively have 20 signatures in order to achieve a YES outcome. If neither of these conditions is satisfied, the resolution will be NO.

para_P.title: By the conclusion of July 2024, will Joe Biden remain in his presidential role, or will a minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate publicly express their opposition to the early nomination strategy?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if one of the following takes place: (a) Joe Biden is still the President of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024; (b) At least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators sign a public letter against the early nomination strategy before the market closes on Sunday, July 21, 2024. It is acceptable for multiple letters to collectively have 20 signatures for a YES outcome. If neither of these scenarios occurs, the answer will be NO.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden still hold the presidency by the end of July 2024, or will there be at least 20 Democrats in the House or Senate who openly oppose the early nomination approach?
para_P.body: This question will receive a YES response if one of the following conditions is met: (a) Joe Biden continues to be the President of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024; (b) A minimum of 20 Democratic Representatives or Senators publicly endorse a letter opposing the early nomination approach before the market closes on Sunday, July 21, 2024. It is permissible for several letters to together have 20 signatures for a YES result. If neither of these conditions is fulfilled, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early (b) Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(b) Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, presents the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are still quite troubled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a smart tactic to suppress debate and I suppose by sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it functions,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House members or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a cumulative total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not satisfied by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

(b) The Democrats will not have a brokered convention in 2024: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only a single round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is necessary, then this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand in the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered resolved as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or via remote means, during the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" transactions involving Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" transactions involving Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Iran initiate a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024, midnight ET, and (b) Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
(a) This part will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. A "military action" is defined as any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions. Only actions explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count. Proxy force attacks do not count.

(b) This part will resolve to "Yes" if credible sources report that Donald Trump has not testified, neither in person nor remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Iran will commence a military operation on Israeli land prior to midnight ET on August 13, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump will not give testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
(a) This segment will be considered "Yes" if Iran conducts a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or waters between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. A "military operation" refers to any forceful action taken by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or waters that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by reliable reporting. This encompasses airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground incursions, but excludes cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic efforts. Only actions that are explicitly claimed by Iran or verified to have originated from Iranian territory will be counted. Attacks by proxy forces are not included.

(b) This segment will be deemed "Yes" if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has not provided testimony, either in person or remotely, at the trial regarding the "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to take place: (a) Will Iran launch a military operation on Israeli land before midnight ET on August 13, 2024, and (b) Will Donald Trump refrain from testifying at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: (a) This component will conclude with a "Yes" if Iran conducts a military operation on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. A "military operation" is understood as any forceful action taken by Iran on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by a consensus of reliable reports. This encompasses airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic measures. Only actions that are explicitly claimed by Iran or verified to have originated from Iranian territory will be considered. Attacks by proxy forces are not included.

para_P.title: Will both of the following occurrences happen: (a) Will Iran initiate a military action on Israeli territory before midnight ET on August 13, 2024, and (b) Will Donald Trump avoid testifying at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: (a) This aspect will be deemed a "Yes" if Iran engages in a military action on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. A "military action" is defined as any aggressive maneuver undertaken by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or corroborated by a consensus of credible reports. This includes aerial bombardments, naval strikes, or ground invasions, but does not account for cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic efforts. Only actions that are overtly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian soil will be taken into account. Attacks carried out by proxy forces are excluded.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial or will Iran initiate a military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels; or (b) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will give testimony at the hush money trial or that Iran will launch a military response prior to midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (a) [Reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or through a remote connection, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels; or (b) Iran commences a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. For this market, a "military operation" will be defined as any act of force carried out by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons depot in Israel, this market will conclude with a "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reports. This encompasses, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber warfare, economic sanctions, or diplomatic measures will not be included in the resolution of this market. Only actions taken by Iranian forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory, will be counted for the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be factored into the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will provide testimony at the hush money trial or that Iran will launch a military strike before the stroke of midnight on August 13th, Eastern Time?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) [Reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, whether in person or virtually, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels; or (b) Iran conducts a military operation on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime zone between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. For the context of this market, a "military operation" refers to any use of force carried out by Iran on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime zone (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons facility on Israeli territory, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or corroborated by a consensus of trustworthy reporting. This encompasses, but is not limited to, aerial bombings, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers will not be considered for the resolution of this market. Only actions taken by Iranian forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will be counted towards the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not contribute to the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Donald Trump will testify during the hush money trial or that Iran will initiate a military attack before midnight on August 13th, Eastern Time?
para_P.body: This question will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs: (a) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels; or (b) Iran carries out a military action on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zone between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this market, a "military action" refers to any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime zone (for example, if an Iranian missile targets a weapons facility within Israeli borders, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or supported by a consensus of reliable reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, aerial bombardments, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic efforts will not be factored into the resolution of this market. Only actions conducted by Iranian forces that are explicitly stated by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian soil will be counted towards the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy organizations (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as depicted in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden's advantage. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

In this scenario, a positive number indicates Trump's lead, while a negative number suggests Biden is in front. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which equates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 and will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this condition is not met. (2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. If both conditions are met, this question resolves as **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) The Democratic Party must go through multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, then this requirement is not fulfilled. (2) The lead that Donald Trump holds over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) must be either 2 or less, or greater than 4, as indicated on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. question.title: Will Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Portugal does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Portugal set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Portugal competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Portugal fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Norway or Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 designate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of securing the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a "No" if Donald Trump is deemed to have a superior chance of winning the US presidential election over Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. If both candidates are viewed as equally likely to win, this market will resolve to a 50-50 outcome.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines on the day of resolution. Any alterations in the methodology that FiveThirtyEight employs to derive its statistics will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the figures for July 20 are released. The resolution may be delayed until the data for July 20 is available. If the July 19 data is not accessible by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest preceding figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate won will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (2) 538 Project Biden as not the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. 

(2) This market will resolve to “Yes” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place: (1) On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 and at most 4 according to 538's national polling average? (2) Will 538 indicate that Biden is not the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) This question will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. 

(2) This market will be marked as “Yes” if Donald Trump is deemed more likely to win the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will be marked as “No” if Joe Biden is more likely to win than Donald Trump based on the same forecast for that date. If both candidates have equal chances, the outcome will be 50-50. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight for their calculations will not affect the outcome of this market.

para_P.body:

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Will Hurd is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, it resolves as No.

(b) Will Will Hurd not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This resolves as Yes if Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, it resolves as Yes. The resolution is based on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Joe Biden makes an announcement before July 15, 2024, stating he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Will Hurd does not become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement that he will not run for or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be straightforward and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination in the 2024 election. If such a declaration is not made by the deadline, it will be considered No.

(b) Will Will Hurd not be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This will be considered Yes if Will Hurd is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other individual is selected, it will also be considered Yes. The resolution depends on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on who is nominated on election day.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden will declare prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Will Hurd will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Is Joe Biden going to make an announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This will be answered with Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign provides a clear, public, and official statement that he will not seek or accept the nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The declaration must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination in the 2024 election. If such an announcement is not made by the deadline, the answer will be No.

(b) Is it the case that Will Hurd will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This will be answered with Yes if Will Hurd is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, it will also resolve as Yes. The outcome depends on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the nominee on election day.

para_P.title: Will both of the following events occur: (a) Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Will Hurd will not be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Is Joe Biden expected to publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This will be considered a Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement indicating that he will not seek or accept the nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unequivocal and definitive, ensuring there is no chance that Biden would agree to take the Democratic Party's nomination in the 2024 election. If such a declaration is not made by the deadline, the response will be No.

(b) Is it true that Will Hurd will not be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This will be answered with Yes if Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other individual is chosen, it will also result in a Yes. The outcome hinges on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is declared as the nominee on election day.

question.title: Will either Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (1) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (2) Elon Musk does not show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. Elon Musk does not become a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, which is one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

If both conditions are met, the question resolves as "Yes". If either condition is not met, the question resolves as "No".

para_P.title: Could it be that either Elon Musk attends Bitcoin Nashville 2024, or that Donald Trump is removed from any state's primary ballot due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a yes answer if at least one of the following occurs:

(a) Elon Musk is announced as a speaker on the main stage at Bitcoin Nashville 2024, a significant Bitcoin conference set for July 25-27, 2024.

(b) Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This disqualification or prevention must be substantiated by official announcements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documentation, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative information, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not suffice for a determination. The question does not take into account any legal challenges, appeals, or later reversals that may occur after the specified date. It solely concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and is later reinstated, leading to him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the answer to the question will be no.

The question will be answered no if neither (a) nor (b) occurs.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a standard Democrat, will he increase his support by at least 3% among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are currently available, both of which conclude on July 6. One of these polls requests Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other solicits votes for a standard Democrat on a similar hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas all other Democrats surveyed in this hypothetical scenario either lead or are within the margin of error. Do Manifold participants reflect the views of the general population?

This market will be deemed YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more upon the closing of both polls.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and that for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until their designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden instead of a typical Democrat, will he receive at least 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
There are two polls conducted by Manifold that will conclude on July 6. One poll asks participants to choose Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to select a typical Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas all other Democrats surveyed in similar scenarios either lead or are within the margin of error. Are the Manifold respondents reflective of the broader population?

This market will be marked YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time the polls close.

The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Other)). The result is YES if the difference between the calculations for poll 1 and poll 2 is 0.03 or greater. Otherwise, the result will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A, and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: Should Trump expect to gain at least 3% more backing from Manifold participants if he competes against Joe Biden rather than a standard Democrat?
para_P.body:
Two polls organized by Manifold will end on July 6. One poll requests participants to vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other seeks their choice of a standard Democrat on a comparable ballot.

Surveys of public opinion consistently show Joe Biden behind Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, while all other Democrats asked in similar situations either lead or are within the margin of error. Do the Manifold participants represent the general population?

This market will be marked YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll exceeds that in the second poll by 3% or more at the closing time of the polls.

The method for calculating the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Other)). If the difference between the results of poll 1 and poll 2 is 0.03 or more, the result is YES. Otherwise, it will be NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve as N/A, and will remain open until the specified closing time regardless of the situation.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) At least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, and (2) Trump gains less than 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
(1) Politico reports that two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out, and two of the most endangered Democrats have written off Biden’s chances to win in November. Behind the scenes, multiple drafts of letters are circulating among House Democrats, with at least one calling on Biden to end his campaign. This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). The individuals must be part of the same group message, such as signing a letter or collectively asking him to drop out. Reports of unnamed Democrats are insufficient unless at least 5 names are made public. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

(2) Two Manifold polls posted, closing on July 6, ask respondents to vote with Joe Biden and a generic Democrat on a hypothetical ballot. This market resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 is less than or equal to that in poll 2 by less than 3% when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of these events take place: (1) A minimum of five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th, and (2) Trump receives under 3% among Manifold participants when pitted against Biden rather than a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
(1) According to Politico, two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to exit the race, and two of the most vulnerable Democrats have dismissed Biden’s chances for victory in November. Privately, several drafts of letters are being circulated among House Democrats, with at least one urging Biden to terminate his campaign. This market will resolve to YES if at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to consider halting his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). The individuals must be part of the same collective communication, such as endorsing a letter or jointly asking him to step down. Reports of unnamed Democrats will not suffice unless at least five names are disclosed. If these conditions are not satisfied by July 20th, the market will resolve to NO.

(2) Two Manifold surveys conducted, concluding on July 6, solicit participants to choose between Joe Biden and a generic Democrat on a theoretical ballot. This market will resolve to YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll is less than or equal to that in the second poll by a margin of less than 3% when both polls are finalized. The calculation for determining Trump’s vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the query) + Someone else)). The outcome will be YES if the difference in these calculations from poll 1 to poll 2 is less than 0.03. Otherwise, it will be NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following two events happen: (1) A minimum of 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th, and (2) Trump receives less than 3% support among Manifold respondents when compared to Biden rather than a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
(1) According to Politico, two members from safe districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside, and two of the most vulnerable Democrats have dismissed Biden's chances for a November victory. Behind closed doors, various drafts of letters are being circulated among House Democrats, with at least one letter requesting Biden to conclude his campaign. This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic US House Members or Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to reflect on ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). The individuals must be part of a collective communication, such as signing a letter or jointly asking him to withdraw. Reports mentioning unnamed Democrats do not count unless at least five names are disclosed. If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

(2) Two Manifold polls, which close on July 6, ask participants to choose between Joe Biden and a generic Democrat on a hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve to YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll is less than or equal to that in the second poll by a margin of less than 3% when both polls conclude. The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat mentioned in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is less than 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

para_P.title: Could there be a scenario where these two occurrences take place: (1) At least five Democratic House Members or US Senators publicly call on Biden to step down prior to July 20th, and (2) Trump garners less than 3% support among Manifold respondents when compared to Biden, rather than a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
(1) As reported by Politico, two representatives from secure districts have already made public appeals for Biden to withdraw, and two of the most at-risk Democrats have downplayed Biden's chances for a win in November. Mentions of unnamed Democrats do not count unless at least five names are provided. If these criteria are not met by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

(2) Two Manifold polls, closing on July 6, ask voters to choose between Joe Biden and a generic Democrat on a hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve to YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll is less than or equal to that in the second poll by a margin of less than 3% when both polls are completed. The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat mentioned in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the result of poll 1 minus the result of poll 2 is less than 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

question.title: Will either Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, or a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
(1) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents? 
- There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.
- This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.
- The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(2) Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
- This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).
- This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.
- The market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.
- Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Trump will increase his support by at least 3% among Manifold participants when compared to Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, or that a coalition of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators will urge Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
(1) When positioned against Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, could Trump boost his support by at least 3% among Manifold participants? 
- Two Manifold polls are available, both concluding on July 6. One poll solicits Manifold participants to vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other requests votes for a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.
- This market will yield a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or greater upon the closing of both polls.
- The calculation for determining the vote percentage for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the difference between the calculation for poll 1 and that for poll 2 is at least 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

(2) Will a coalition of at least 5 specified Democratic House Members or US Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw before July 20th? 
- This market resolves to YES if a coalition of no fewer than five identified Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators collectively ask Joe Biden to contemplate withdrawing from his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).
- This could be executed through signing a letter or another method such as a group engaging with Biden directly and collectively urging him to step aside.
- The market stipulates that all five individuals must be part of the same collective message. If five individuals independently express to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw, it will not suffice for a YES resolution.
- Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats requesting Biden to step down will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public prior to the market's closing date. In unclear situations where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Trump will increase his support by at least 3% among Manifold respondents when compared to Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, or that a coalition of no fewer than 5 specific Democratic House Members or US Senators will urge Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20th?
para_P.body:
(1) When comparing Joe Biden to a generic Democrat, will Trump see a rise of at least 3% among Manifold respondents? 
- Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll queries Manifold respondents about voting for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other inquires about voting for a generic Democrat. 
- This market will be considered YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 surpasses that in poll 2 by 3% or more at the close of both polls. 
- The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the difference between poll 1's formula and poll 2's formula is at least 0.03. Otherwise, the outcome is NO.

(2) Will a coalition of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to consider stepping down before July 20th? 
- This market resolves YES if a coalition of no fewer than five named Democratic US House Members or Senators collaborates to ask Joe Biden to think about ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to actively encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). 
- This could occur through signing a letter or through a group meeting with Biden where they collectively request his withdrawal. 
- The market stipulates that all five individuals must be part of the same collective message. If five individuals express their thoughts separately to reporters that Biden should resign, it will not qualify for a YES resolution. 
- Any reports of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and requesting him to step aside will not meet the requirements of this market unless at least 5 qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's closing date. In any unclear situations where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

para_P.title: Could Trump potentially boost his backing by a minimum of 3% among Manifold participants compared to Joe Biden instead of a typical Democrat, or will a group of at least 5 specific Democratic House Members or US Senators advocate for Biden to withdraw from the presidential race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
(1) In the comparison between Joe Biden and a typical Democrat, is it possible for Trump to achieve an increase of at least 3% among Manifold participants? 
- There are two Manifold polls available, both concluding on July 6. One survey asks Manifold participants about their vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks about their vote for a typical Democrat. 
- This market will be deemed YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll exceeds that in the second poll by 3% or more at the conclusion of both polls. 
- Trump's voting percentage is calculated as (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the calculations from poll 1 and poll 2 is at least 0.03. If not, the result is NO.

(2) Will a coalition of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators exert pressure on Biden to contemplate stepping aside before July 20th? 
- This market resolves YES if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic US House Members or Senators collaborates to urge Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to actively encourage him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). 
- This could happen through signing a letter or via a group meeting with Biden where they collectively request his resignation. 
- The market specifies that all five individuals must be part of the same collective message. If five individuals express their opinions separately to reporters that Biden should resign, it will not qualify for a YES resolution. 
- Any reports of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and requesting him to step aside will not satisfy the requirements of this market unless at least 5 qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the market's closing date. In ambiguous situations where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If either Czechia does not qualify or Belgium qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Czechia make it to the Grand Final while Belgium does not in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Czechia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Belgium competes in a Semi-final and is not confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia fails to qualify or Belgium qualifies, the inquiry will be considered **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Czechia to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 while Belgium does not?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Czechia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Belgium competes in a Semi-final and is not confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia fails to qualify or Belgium qualifies, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

para_P.title: Can Czechia reach the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 if Belgium does not?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is later acknowledged by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Belgium takes part in a Semi-final and is not acknowledged by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify or if Belgium qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Belgium or Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs: (a) Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Belgium nor Czechia qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Belgium or Czechia make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) Belgium takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Czechia competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will be deemed **No** if neither Belgium nor Czechia advances.

para_P.title: Will either Belgium or Czech Republic make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Belgium competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Czech Republic competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Belgium nor Czech Republic qualifies, the inquiry will be answered with **No**.

para_P.title: Will either Belgium or Czech Republic reach the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This question will receive a response of **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs: (a) Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially acknowledged by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having obtained a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Czech Republic participates in a Semi-final and is officially acknowledged by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having obtained a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Belgium nor Czech Republic qualifies, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as illustrated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure denotes a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as documented in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 but less than 3 according to 538's national polling average on July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered based on how much Donald Trump is leading Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the data for July 15, 2024, which will be evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number reflects Trump's lead, while a negative number indicates that Biden is in front. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which means a positive value of 2.4 is relevant for this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Nvidia's market cap is larger than Apple's on June 28, 2024 (b) Trump's lead over Biden is <= 2 or > 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. The condition is satisfied if Trump's lead is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, and (b) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following events will take place: (a) Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024, and (b) Trump's advantage over Biden will be at most 2 or exceed 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable sources report that an attack linked to Israel occurring within Iran has resulted in the deaths of at least five people.

(b) This question will conclude with Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, if on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, this would count as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following events will take place: (a) Israel conducts a lethal strike within the territory of Iran prior to May 1, 2024, and (b) Trump's advantage over Biden is either less than or equal to 2 or exceeds 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling averages?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports emerge indicating that an assault attributed to Israel, occurring within Iranian territory, has resulted in the fatalities of at least five people.

(b) This question will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden. For instance, if on July 5, 2024, the reported value is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, this would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: Could both of the following occurrences happen: (a) Israel executes a deadly strike on Iranian soil before May 1, 2024, and (b) Trump's lead over Biden is either 2 or lower, or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling averages?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be answered **Yes** if, following the publication of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible reports surface indicating that an attack attributed to Israel within Iran has resulted in the deaths of at least five individuals.

(b) The outcome of this inquiry will be determined based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. (b) This question will be marked **Yes** if, after the publication of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports confirm that an assault attributed to Israel has occurred within Iran, resulting in the deaths of at least five people.
