(a) This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

(b) This question will be answered **Yes** if, after the publication date of this inquiry and before May 1, 2024, reliable sources confirm that an attack linked to Israel occurred within Iran, resulting in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" will be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined, and (b) "Twisters" (2024) will have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of less than 75%?

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024, and will Nikki Haley not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) At 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States. (2) Nikki Haley is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: By the conclusion of July 2024, will Joe Biden remain in his position as president, and will Nikki Haley not be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) At 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States. (2) Nikki Haley is not nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; what matters is who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden continue to hold the presidency until the end of July 2024, and will Nikki Haley not be the selected Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with a **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) At 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden is still serving as the president of the United States. question.title: Will either Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Nikki Haley becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Joe Biden remains president until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met:

(a) Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made based on the selection by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than who is awarded the Republican nomination on election day in 2024.

(b) Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if one of the following situations occurs:

(a) Nikki Haley is appointed as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. This decision is based on the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden remains the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

para_P.title: By the conclusion of July 2024, will Nikki Haley be the selected Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or will Joe Biden still be in office as president?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following conditions is met:

(a) Nikki Haley is designated as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. This determination is reliant on the decision made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden continues to serve as the president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and it will be **No** for any other results. In the event of a tie between two groups for seats, both sub-questions will be resolved as **Yes**.

This question will be determined based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

In the event that two factions have an equal number of seats, both sub-questions will be considered as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will rely on [official declarations from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy news sources.

para_P.body:

If two parties end up with the same number of seats, both sub-questions will be regarded as **Yes**.

The answer to this question will depend on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news outlets.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, and (b) Greens–EFA not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) The question resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to certain groups, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, still resolving positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups are tied for seats, this question resolves as **No**. This resolves based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry will be resolved as **YES** if ChatGPT is widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Widely accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can utilize it without a VPN (possibly requiring a payment). If it is not available in certain EU nations, or not available to specific demographics, it will still resolve positively, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" pertains to the general online interface for engaging with GPT models, still resolving positively if the name or website has been altered, as long as OpenAI's service remains largely unchanged.

(b) This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction does not secure the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If there is a tie between two groups for the number of seats, this question will resolve as **No**. This determination will be based on official announcements by the European Parliament or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either (a) the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. 

For (a), the question resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and as **No** for all other outcomes. It still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

"ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Could it occur that one of the following takes place: (a) the Greens–EFA group obtains the greatest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is made broadly available in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if either (a) the Greens–EFA group obtains the greatest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is made broadly available in the EU by June 30, 2024. 

For (a), the question is answered as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA group has the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and as **No** in all other cases. If two groups have the same number of seats, this will also be answered as **Yes**. This conclusion is based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media outlets.

Regarding (b), the question is answered as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely available in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Widely available" indicates that the typical situation for individuals in the EU is that they can access it without using a VPN (potentially requiring payment). If it is not accessible in certain EU countries or to minors, it will still be answered positively, provided that over 50% of the population can utilize it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. It will still be answered positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Background from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to publicly oppose their party's attempt to finalize President Joe Biden's nomination sooner than initially intended, claiming it suppresses the critical ongoing discussions regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in this initiative.

A letter drafted and shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats following the weekend’s assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still quite concerned about Biden’s candidacy moving forward.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to shut down debate and I suppose through sheer force, create unity, but it doesn’t function that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming whether the letter exists.

This market will be deemed YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators associated with the Democratic Party before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if there are several such statements totaling 20 lawmakers' endorsements, it would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Larry Elder will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats will sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. If these criteria are met by market close, this condition resolves YES; otherwise, it resolves NO.

Both conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as **Yes**. If either condition is not met, this question resolves as **No**.

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, as verified by the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden fall between 2 and 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as illustrated in the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden on July 15, 2024, exceed 2 but remain under 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question will be addressed based on the margin by which Donald Trump leads Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as depicted in the graph for July 15, 2024, when evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number signifies Trump's superiority, while a negative number indicates Biden's advantage. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which corresponds to a positive value of 2.4 for this analysis.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP (2) Trump's lead over Biden is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(1) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

(2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.body:
(1) Kamala Harris will be chosen as the Democratic Vice President. If Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic VP, this market will affirm a yes outcome. If another individual is appointed as VP, the market will conclude with a no. Any changes to the VP after the initial selection will not alter the resolution of this market. The market can confirm its resolution right after the selection.

(2) Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential race, as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is either 2 points or fewer, or exceeds 4 points. For this inquiry, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies a Biden lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the context of this inquiry.

For example, as of July 5, 2024, if the reported figure indicates Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, that would be regarded as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden continue to hold the office of President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered TRUE if Biden is still serving as the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be deemed FALSE if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a TRUE outcome. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to stay in office until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be marked as YES if Biden continues to serve as the US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be marked as NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a YES outcome. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Can Biden remain in his position until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be marked as YES if Biden is still the US President by the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be marked as NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before that date.

A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (like designating his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES result. (The position of Acting President is separate from that of President as per the Constitution)

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden ceases to be President before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: 

1. Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not affected by who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. Joe Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be US President before the end of July 2024 (ET). Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not count as ceasing to be President for this question.

If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves as **Yes**. If either or both conditions are not satisfied, the question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but at most 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump was 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would translate to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden will still be president by the end of July 2024 and (b) Trump's lead over Biden will be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates Biden is leading.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

For instance, a 50-minute video might contain only 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and previous segments on 60 Minutes have all featured less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

(a) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024 for this to resolve YES. The interview must be on camera, and can include appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, but must have at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls do not count.

(b) Trump's lead over Biden must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This will be determined by the value reported on 538's national polling average chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following takes place: (a) Joe Biden engages in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024, or (b) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 3 but is 4 or less on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) For this to be considered TRUE, Joe Biden needs to participate in a face-to-face interview for a minimum of 45 minutes before July 2024 ends. The interview must be recorded on video and may include segments from podcasts, late-night television, or programs like 60 Minutes, but it should contain at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person. Events such as press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls are excluded from this count.

(b) Trump's lead over Biden must be greater than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538. This will be verified using the data from 538's national polling average chart for July 15, 2024, which Metaculus will review on July 17, 2024. A positive figure will indicate that Trump is in the lead.

para_P.title: Is it possible for either of the following to take place: (a) Joe Biden engages in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024, or (b) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 3 but is at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) For this to be considered a YES, Joe Biden needs to participate in a face-to-face interview lasting no less than 45 minutes before July 2024 ends. The interview should be on camera and can take place on platforms such as podcasts, late-night television, or programs like 60 Minutes, but there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden in a personal interview. Events like press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls are excluded from this count.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Trump's lead over Biden must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4, as per 538's national polling average. This will be evaluated based on the figure shown on 538's national polling average chart for that date, which Metaculus will check on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates that Trump is leading.

para_P.title: Could either of the following scenarios occur: (a) Joe Biden participates in a recorded face-to-face interview or discussion lasting more than 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, or (b) Trump's lead over Biden is more than 3 but no greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) For this to be deemed a YES, Joe Biden must take part in a recorded face-to-face interview lasting at least 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024. The interview should be on camera and may occur on platforms such as podcasts, late-night shows, or programs like 60 Minutes, but it must consist of a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden in a personal interview. Events like press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls do not count towards this duration.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Trump's lead over Biden must exceed 3 and be at most 4, based on 538's national polling average. This will be assessed using the data displayed on 538's national polling average chart for that date, which Metaculus will verify on July 17, 2024. A positive number indicates that Trump is in the lead.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.body:

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a smart tactic to shut down debate and, by sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He didn’t confirm whether the letter exists.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the accelerated nomination plan is signed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if multiple letters collectively contain 20 signatures from lawmakers, that would also be enough to determine this market as YES. 

If these conditions are not satisfied by market closure, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 and (b) fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This occurs if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this does not occur.

(b) Fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This occurs if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. If these criteria are not met by market close, this does not occur.
